entries: The destrachan focuses its harmonics against a single item within 60 feet that is made of crystal, metal, stone, or wood. The target object takes {@damage 7d8} sonic damage. If the item is attended, its bearer can attempt a DC 26 basic Reflex save for the item. The destrachan can't use Shattering Harmonics again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Shattering Harmonics

entries: A spellcaster who targets a devourer with a mental spell, banishment, bind soul, divine decree, divine wrath, possession, spirit blast, or spirit song can attempt a counteract check to free a soul the devourer has trapped with Devour Soul. If this counteract attempt succeeds, the trapped soul is released (though the creature remains dead), and the devourer can't use any soul charges from that creature. Devourers are otherwise immune to these spells.
mid.name: Spell Deflection

entries: The devourer touches a creature within reach, dealing {@damage 8d6} negative damage (DC 31 basic Fortitude save). If a creature is slain by this attack, its soul becomes trapped within the devourer. While its soul is trapped, a creature can't be resurrected except by powerful magic such as a {@spell wish} spell.

Destroying the devourer or successfully counteracting Devour Soul (see Spell Deflection above) releases the soul. The devourer can hold only one soul at a time. A soul has 5 soul charges per level of the originating creature (see Soul Spells below). The devourer can expend these charges to cast spells. If the soul is freed and the creature returns to life, the creature is {@condition drained 1} for every 5 soul charges expended. If reduced to 0 soul charges, the soul is consumed and can be restored to life only by powerful magic such as wish.
bot.name: Devour Soul

entries: When the devourer damages a living creature with its claw {@action Strike}, the devourer gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the devourer increases the condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: A devourer casts occult innate spells, but to do so it must expend a number of soul charges equal to the spell's level (similar to casting a spell using charges from a staff). It can heighten any spell to a maximum of 6th level by expending more charges as it Casts the Spell. When encountered, a devourer typically has one trapped soul with 10 soul charges.
bot.name: Soul Spells

entries: A dig-widget's face consists of a set of infiltrator thieves' tools. They can be salvaged from a destroyed dig-widget with a successful DC 20 {@skill Crafting} check. On a failed check, the tools are destroyed.
top.name: Infiltration Tools

entries: A creature with expert proficiency in {@skill Thievery} can attempt a check to {@action Disable a Device} to damage a dig-widget. The DC is 22, and each success deals 20 damage.
mid.name: Mechanical Vulnerability

entries: The dig-widget Leaps up 20 feet onto a creature or object and attempts a corkscrew {@action Strike} against it. If the {@action Strike} damages the target, the dig-widget attaches to the target (typically to the back of a creature). This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the dig-widget moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. While attached, the dig-widget can't use its corkscrew. The dig-widget can be Shoved off, or it can detach itself with an {@action Interact} action.
bot.name: Fastening Leap

entries: A dig-widget's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A doprillu's unique wooden mask is the source of its power. A doprillu deprived of its mask loses its regeneration and its immunity to {@condition enfeebled} and {@condition slowed}, and it immediately becomes {@condition enfeebled 1}. The {@condition enfeebled} value increases by 1 at the start of each of the doprillu's turns, to a maximum of {@condition enfeebled 4}. If the mask is put back on, the doprillu immediately regains its abilities and loses the {@condition enfeebled} condition. A creature can pull off the mask with a successful DC 34 {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Force Open}.
mid.name: Mask of Power

entries: Fiery magma runs through the doprillu's veins.
A creature that starts its turn {@condition grabbed} by the doprillu takes {@damage 7d6} fire damage.
mid.name: Volcanic Veins

mid.trigger: The doprillu is the target of a physical ranged attack
mid.requirements: The doprillu is aware of the attack, isn't {@condition flat-footed} against it, and has a hand free
entries: The doprillu gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.
mid.name: Deflect Arrow

bot.requirements: The doprillu has a creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The doprillu swings the {@condition grabbed} creature as a weapon. This Strike has a +30 attack modifier and deals {@damage 3d8+16} bludgeoning damage. The Strike is magical and has a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, the {@condition grabbed} creature takes half the damage dealt to the target.
bot.name: Body Strike

bot.requirements: The doprillu has a creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The doprillu whirls the {@condition grabbed} creature about, making a Body {@action Strike} against each creature in reach. After that {@action Strike}, the doprillu can hurl the {@condition grabbed} creature up to 50 feet as a ranged {@action Strike}. This {@action Strike} has the same attack modifier and damage as Body {@action Strike}, but has the thrown <20 feet> weapon trait.
bot.name: Whirlwind Throw

entries: A dracolisk has resistance 10 to the type of damage it produces with its breath weapon (see below).
mid.name: Draconic Resistance

mid.trigger: A creature within 30 feet that the dracolisk can see starts its turn
entries: The target must attempt a DC 26 Fortitude save. If it fails, it becomes {@condition slowed 1} for 1 minute as its body stiffens.
mid.name: Petrifying Glance

entries: The dracolisk breathes a gout of energy based on its draconic heritage, as noted below. This breath weapon deals {@dice 6d10} damage of the appropriate type, with a DC 28 basic save of a type indicated in parenthesis below. The dracolisk can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: 60-foot line of acid (Reflex)
bot.name: Black

entries: 60-foot line of electricity (Reflex)
bot.name: Blue

entries: 30-foot cone of poison (Fortitude)
bot.name: Green

entries: 30-foot cone of fire (Reflex)
bot.name: Red

entries: 30-foot cone of cold (Reflex)
bot.name: White

entries: The dracolisk stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a DC 28 Fortitude save. If it fails and has not already been {@condition slowed} by Petrifying Glance or this ability, it becomes {@condition slowed 1}. If the creature already was {@condition slowed} by this ability or Petrifying Glance, a failed save causes the creature to be {@condition petrified} permanently.

A creature {@condition petrified} in this manner can be instantly restored to flesh by being coated (not just splashed) with fresh dracolisk or basilisk blood no more than 1 hour old. A single dracolisk contains enough blood to coat {@dice 1d4+2} Medium creatures in this manner.
bot.name: Petrifying Gaze

entries: The dracolisk makes a single {@action Strike} with its jaws. If the attack hits, it deals {@damage 4d12+16} piercing damage (versatile S )
This counts as two attacks for its multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Savage Jaws

entries: The drainberry bush can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of animals and plant creatures.
top.name: Nature Empathy

entries: The drainberry bush must drain blood from living creatures for sustenance. This causes clusters of bright red berries to grow among its branches. Each cluster of berries lasts for 1 day, and a drainberry bush typically has {@dice 1d6+3} clusters when encountered. When consumed, a cluster restores {@dice 2d8+10} Hit Points. This effect has the healing, {@trait necromancy}, and {@trait primal} traits.
A creature can pluck a cluster of berries with a successful unarmed {@action Strike} or {@skill Thievery} check against the bush's AC.
bot.name: Blood Berries

entries: The bush draws nourishment from one cluster of blood berries, regaining {@dice 2d8+10} HP. That berry cluster wrinkles and dies.
bot.name: Consume Berries

bot.requirements: The drainberry bush has at least one living creature {@condition grabbed} with one of its vines
entries: The bush's hollow thorns siphon blood from creatures it has {@condition grabbed}. Each creature must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or take {@dice 2d8+10} damage and become {@condition drained 1} (double damage and {@condition drained 2} on a critical failure). For every creature damaged this way, a cluster of blood berries (see above) immediately grows along the bush's branches.
bot.name: Drain Blood

entries: The drainberry bush makes up to four vine {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the bush's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the bush makes all these attacks.
bot.name: Storm of Vines

entries: A creature that slays a draugr is subjected to a mariner's curse spell with a save DC of 17. The curse ends if the draugr is buried in a calm sea or after 1 week passes.
mid.name: The Sea's Revenge

entries: A draugr's attacks spatter their targets with rancid flesh and rotting seaweed.
A creature damaged by a draugr's {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 15 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} ({@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Grotesque Gift

entries: The draugr makes a melee {@action Strike} and compares the attack roll result to the AC of up to two foes, each of whom must be within its melee reach and adjacent to each other. Roll damage only once and apply it to each creature hit. A Swipe counts as two attacks for the draugr's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Swipe

entries: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. It recovers after it has been out of the aura for 1 minute. This {@condition drained} condition value is cumulative with the {@condition drained} value caused by drain life, but not with multiple draining presence auras. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to draining presence for 24 hours.
mid.name: Draining Presence

entries: A dread wraith caught in sunlight is {@condition stunned 2} and {@condition clumsy 2}.
mid.name: Sunlight Powerlessness

entries: The dread wraith extends its hand toward another wraith creature within 100 feet. The target wraith dissolves and streaks toward the dread wraith in a straight line, dealing {@damage 6d10} negative damage to each creature along the line (DC 28 basic Fortitude save). The dread wraith absorbs the essence of the target wraith, becoming {@condition quickened} and gaining a +10-foot status bonus to its fly Speed for a number of rounds equal to the level of the absorbed wraith. It can use its extra action only to {@action Fly} or {@action Strike}. An unwilling target can attempt a DC 28 Will save to resist being absorbed.
bot.name: Absorb Wraith

entries: When the dread wraith damages a living creature with its spectral hand {@action Strike}, the wraith gains 10 temporary Hit Points and the target must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the wraith increases the {@condition drained} condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: A living humanoid slain by a wraith's spectral hand {@action Strike} rises as a wraith spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds. This wraith spawn is under the command of the dread wraith that killed it. It doesn't have drain life or wraith spawn. If the creator of the wraith spawn dies, the wraith spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wraith; it regains its free will and gains drain life and wraith spawn.
bot.name: Wraith Spawn

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

attacks.name: web
effects: web trap plus dream spider venom

entries: The dream spider has imprecise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Web Sense

entries: A creature hit by the dream spider's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 16).
bot.name: Web Trap

entries: Each turn, the first time the duneshaker solifugid is adjacent to a Large or smaller creature during a move action it's using, that creature must succeed at a DC 39 Reflex save or fall {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Earth Shaker

entries: The duneshaker solifugid {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the duneshaker solifugid began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The duneshaker solifugid spews toxic barbs at all creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each creature within the area takes {@damage 10d6} poison damage (DC 39 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d6} rounds (or permanently on a critical failure). The duneshaker solifugid can't use Venom Spray again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Venom Spray

entries: The dust mephit breathes a cloud of dust in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} slashing damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The dust mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

mid.trigger: The dweomercat is targeted by a spell or is within the area of a spell as it is cast
entries: The dweomercat gains an effect related to the school of the triggering spell. This effect occurs before the dweomercat is affected by the triggering spell. The effect lasts for 1 minute, until the dweomercat uses this ability again, or until the dweomercat Dismisses the effect, whichever comes first.
mid.name: Alter Dweomer

entries: The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to AC.
mid.name: Abjuration

entries: A cloud of fog appears in a 5-foot burst centered on a corner of the dweomercat's space. Anything in the cloud is {@condition concealed}.
mid.name: Conjuration

entries: The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all skill checks.
mid.name: Divination

entries: The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all saves.
mid.name: Enchantment

entries: Magical feedback deals {@damage 4d6} force damage to the triggering spellcaster (DC 22 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Evocation

entries: The dweomercat becomes {@condition invisible}. This effect ends if the dweomercat uses a {@condition hostile} action, in addition to the normal end conditions.
mid.name: Illusion

entries: The dweomercat gains 10 temporary HP.
mid.name: Necromancy

entries: The dweomercat gains a +1 status bonus to all attack rolls.
mid.name: Transmutation

bot.prerequisites: The dweomercat has at least one {@spell dimension door} spell remaining
entries: The dweomercat casts dimension door, then can make a melee {@action Strike} against one creature adjacent to it at the end of its teleport. If the dweomercat ends its teleport adjacent to a creature under an ongoing spell effect or who cast a spell since the dweomercat's last turn, this does not expend a casting of dimension door.
bot.name: Dweomer Leap

entries: The dweomercat {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the dweomercat began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: An earthen destrier can {@action Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: If the destrier moved at least 10 feet directly before its lance arm {@action Strike}, it gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its damage roll.
bot.name: Lancing Charge

bot.trigger: The earthen destrier tramples a creature
entries: The earthen destrier makes a lance arm {@action Strike} against the creature it's trampling at a –5 penalty.
bot.name: Tilting Strike

entries: Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 20
bot.name: Trample

entries: The elasmosaurus can hold its breath for 2 hours.
top.name: Deep Breath

entries: An elasmosaurus's long neck allows it to interact with the surface while its body remains submerged underwater. While submerged no deeper than 15 feet underwater, an elasmosaurus can still stick its head up to breathe. An elasmosaurus gains cover against attacks made against creatures who are above the water's surface while it is underwater, even if its head is above the surface.
mid.name: Long Neck

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The elasmosaurus attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against a {@condition grabbed} foe's Fortitude DC. If the elasmosaurus succeeds, the foe is forcibly moved 5 feet toward the elasmosaurus's body. If the elasmosaurus critically succeeds, the foe is moved 10 feet towards the elasmosaurus's body.
bot.name: Drag Below

entries: A swimming elasmosaurus thrashes the area around it as it attempts to flee.

It makes two paddle {@action Strike||Strikes}, each of which must be against separate targets, and each of which takes the normal multiple attack penalty. It then Swims up to its swim Speed. This {@action Swim} does not trigger reactions based on movement.
bot.name: Thrashing Retreat

entries: Some elementals embody aspects of air such as smoke, lightning, and fog.
bot.name: Elemental, Air

mid.trigger: An adjacent ally is targeted by an effect that deals fire damage
entries: The ember fox drapes itself across its ally, granting the ally fire resistance 10 against the incoming attack.
mid.name: Cloak in Embers

entries: The emperor cobra flares its hood. Each non–emperor cobra creature within a 20-foot emanation must attempt a DC 22 Will save.
The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 3}.

bot.name: Flare Hood

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d8+19} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed} and exquisite pain

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+19} slashing plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed}, exquisite pain, and {@ability Improved Grab}

spells.name: plane shift
notes: to Material Plane or Shadow Plane only

entries: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the {@condition doomed}, {@condition dying}, and {@condition wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.
top.name: Painsight

entries: An eremite's actions can't be disrupted due to damage or {@action Strike||Strikes} (such as {@action Attack of Opportunity}).
mid.name: Ignore Pain

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it feels compelled to offer pieces of its own flesh to the eremite. The creature must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.
mid.name: Paralytic Perfection

bot.requirements: The eremite has a creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The eremite excises flesh or bone from a creature it has {@condition grabbed}. The target takes {@damage 6d10} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Evisceration

entries: An eremite's knowledge of pressure points and pain centers is unsurpassed. A creature hit by an eremite's melee {@action Strike||Strikes} must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or be {@condition stunned 2} ({@condition stunned 4} on a critical failure). A creature that critically succeeds is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
bot.name: Exquisite Pain

entries: The eremite stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against paralytic perfection.
In addition, if the creature was already {@condition paralyzed}, on a failed save, its unnatural longing causes it to become {@condition doomed 1}.
After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the eremite's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

bot.requirements: The eremite holds a piece of flesh they collected via Evisceration
entries: The eremite attaches the stolen flesh to themself. They either regain 100 Hit Points; reduce the value of their {@condition clumsy}, {@condition drained}, {@condition enfeebled}, or {@condition stupefied} condition by 3; or reduce the stage of any affliction affecting them by 3.
bot.name: Graft Flesh

entries: When an eremite uses plane shift or shadow walk, they arrive at exactly their intended destination.
bot.name: Shadow Traveler

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+3} piercing plus Grab and spirit touch

entries: The esobok {@action Stride||Strides} and then makes a {@action Strike}. If it began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: An esobok's {@action Strike||Strikes} affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a {@item ghost touch} property rune and deal {@damage 1d6} negative damage to living creatures and {@damage 1d6} positive damage to undead.
bot.name: Spirit Touch

entries: Requirement A creature is {@condition grabbed} by the esobok's jaws; The esobok releases the target from the Grab but wrenches its spirit free as it does so. The creature must attempt a DC 20 Will save. Creatures without souls (such as most constructs) and creatures whose bodies and souls are one (such as most celestials, fiends, and monitors) that roll a failure or critical failure on the save get a success instead.

entries.Success: The target is {@condition stunned 1}.
entries.Failure: The esobok wrenches the target's soul from its body into its jaws. Mindless undead creatures of level 2 or lower are destroyed, other undead creatures are {@condition stunned} for 1 round, and all other creatures are {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, a creature {@condition paralyzed} by this effect can attempt a new save to end the effect. The paralysis ends automatically if the esobok attempts a jaws {@action Strike} or speaks.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but as long as a creature is {@condition stunned} or {@condition paralyzed}, it is also {@condition stupefied 2}.

bot.name: Wrench Spirit

attacks.name: chain
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+7} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed} and impaling chain

entries: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the {@condition doomed}, {@condition dying}, and {@condition wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.
top.name: Painsight

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees the face of a departed loved one in place of the evangelist's face. The creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened 2} ({@condition frightened 3} on a critical failure).
mid.name: Unnerving Gaze

entries: Chains in the evangelist's vicinity sprout barbs and writhe menacingly. The evangelist can make chain {@action Strike||Strikes} against any creature that is adjacent to an unattended chain within 20 feet, in addition to those within the reach of the evangelist's chain {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Animate Chains

entries: The evangelist stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against unnerving gaze. In addition, if the creature was already {@condition frightened}, on a failed save, the evangelist is {@condition concealed} from the creature for as long as the creature remains {@condition frightened}. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the evangelist's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

entries: When the evangelist critically hits with a chain {@action Strike}, the target is impaled and anchored in place, becoming {@condition grabbed} by the chain. The creature is unable to recover from {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} until it gets free (DC 25 {@action Escape}).
bot.name: Impaling Chain
Pyrexic Malaria
bot.note: The victim can't reduce its {@condition sickened} condition while it's affected by pyrexic malaria

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage (DC 20 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to pyrexic malaria. Creatures that fail the saving throw also take {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Swarming Bites

entries: When the fetchling scout is {@condition concealed} as a result of dim light, the flat check to target them has a DC of 7, not 5.
mid.name: Shadow Blending

bot.requirements: The fetchling is in dim light
entries: The fetchling {@action Stride||Strides}. They have a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed during this {@action Stride}. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this {@action Stride}, and the fetchling remains concealed by dim light until the end of the movement, even if they leave dim light during the {@action Stride}.
bot.name: Shadow Stride

entries: The fetchling scout's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The filth fire ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: Toxic materials and churning rubbish within the filth fire's body explode in one of three ways. The filth fire chooses the effect, but it can't make the same choice twice in a row.

items: {@bold Fiery Beam} (evocation, fire, primal) The filth fire expels a 30-foot line of flame that deals {@damage 3d6} fire damage with a DC 21 basic Reflex save.
{@bold Shrapnel Blast} (evocation, primal) The filth fire shoots jagged rubbish out in a 5-foot emanation that deals {@damage 2d12} piercing damage with a DC 21 basic Reflex save.

{@bold Toxic Fumes} (evocation, poison, primal) The filth fire belches a 15-foot cone of toxic smoke that deals {@damage 2d6} poison damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails is also {@condition sickened 1} (or {@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure).

bot.name: Noxious Burst

entries: Fire jellyfish swarms use {@skill Acrobatics} to {@action Swim}.
bot.name: Agile Swimmer

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 3d8} poison damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save) and is exposed to fire jelly venom.
bot.name: Burning Swarm

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+16} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} fire and {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire}

entries: The fire yai takes on the appearance of a {@creature fire giant}. This doesn't change their Speed or {@action Strike} attack and damage.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The fire yai attempts a katana {@action Strike}. If it hits, the fire yai attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the target creature's Fortitude DC.

entries.Critical Success: The fire yai {@action Stride||Strides} or Flies up to half its Speed in any direction. The struck creature takes {@damage 4d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and is pushed along with the yai an equal distance. The creature is {@condition grabbed} until the yai's next turn or until the yai makes a katana {@action Strike}.
entries.Success: As critical success, but the creature takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
entries.Failure: The struck creature is pushed back 5 feet.
entries.Critical Failure: The struck creature is unaffected.

bot.name: Impaling Push

entries: The fire yai transforms into a cloud of smoke and then Flies up to its fly speed. This movement does not trigger reactions, and the fire yai can move through spaces occupied by other creatures. The fire yai returns to its physical form after this move, and must end the movement in a space in which it can fit. All creatures in spaces through which the fire yai moves with Smoke Form must succeed at a DC 34 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 3}. The fire yai cannot use Smoke Form for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Smoke Form

entries: When a creature slays a fjord linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 41 Will save or become unable to ever breathe underwater (either via a natural ability or a spell such as water breathing). In addition, the victim can hold its breath only half as long as normal, and whenever it holds its breath it becomes {@condition sickened 2}.
mid.name: Curse of Stolen Breath

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The fjord linnorm expels a 120-foot line of icy bile, dealing {@damage 17d6} cold damage to creatures within the area (DC 37 basic Reflex save)

Any creature that fails its save is covered by the ice, which freezes and fuses with the creature's skin, giving it a –10-foot penalty to Speed. A creature can {@action Escape} or {@action Force Open} the ice (DC 34) to free itself; otherwise, the ice remains for 1 minute. The fjord linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

attacks.name: flytrap mouth
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8+6} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} acid and flytrap toxin

attacks.name: flytrap hand
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d6+6} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} acid and flytrap toxin

entries: As sunflower leshy, except plants regain {@dice 3d6} Hit Points and the area sprouts flytraps instead of sunflowers.
mid.name: Verdant Burst

entries: A flytrap leshy can combine itself with an adjacent and willing flytrap leshy that is not currently affected by Amalgam. The leshy using Amalgam physically merges with the target, restoring {@dice 3d8} Hit Points to the target. The leshy can {@action Sustain a Spell} to continue Amalgam, but once they stop, the target leshy takes {@dice 3d8} damage. If the target leshy dies, Amalgam ends at once and the original leshy gains the {@condition dying} condition or increases their {@condition dying} condition value by 1 if they were already {@condition dying}. As long as Amalgam is sustained, the target leshy gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws, its AC increases to 21, and it gains an additional reaction at the start of each turn.
bot.name: Amalgam

entries: The flytrap leshy transforms into a Small flytrap. This ability otherwise uses the effects of tree shape.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A froghemoth's alien eyes allow it to perceive creatures within 30 feet, even if they are {@condition invisible} or ethereal. It can still be fooled by successful {@skill Stealth} checks to {@action Hide}, but it has {@skill Perception} DC 38 in such cases. It also sees through and is unaffected by illusions with the {@trait visual} trait if they are within 30 feet.
top.name: Otherworldly Vision

entries: Though a froghemoth is immune to electricity damage, it is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round whenever it would have otherwise taken electricity damage.
mid.name: Electric Torpor

entries: A creature hit by the froghemoth's tongue becomes {@condition grabbed} by the froghemoth. The creature isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the froghemoth's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful {@action Strike} against AC 31 that deals at least 15 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the froghemoth but prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike} until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 minute.
bot.name: Barbed Tongue

entries: The froghemoth makes up to four tentacle {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These count toward the froghemoth's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
bot.name: Flailing Tentacles

entries: The froghemoth pulls a creature {@condition grabbed} by its tongue toward itself. The froghemoth rolls an {@skill Athletics} check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the froghemoth pulls the creature into an adjacent space, and if it critically succeeds it can also make a bite {@action Strike} against the creature after the pull.
bot.name: Retract Tongue

entries: Large, {@damage 3d6+9} bludgeoning, Rupture 24.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A frost troll isn't impeded by {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by snow or ice, nor do they need to attempt {@skill Acrobatics} checks to keep from falling on slippery ice.
bot.name: Ice Stride

entries: When a frost worm dies, it explodes in a 100-foot burst of searing cold blood. All creatures and objects in range take {@damage 10d8} cold damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Death Throes

entries: 5 feet. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the emanation takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Worm Chill

mid.trigger: The frost worm takes piercing or slashing damage
entries: The frost worm's freezing blood sprays out on a random creature within 10 feet of the frost worm. That creature takes {@damage 7d6} cold damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Freezing Blood

entries: The frost worm exhales a blast of frost, dealing {@damage 13d6} cold damage to creatures in a 50-foot cone (DC 32 basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The frost worm emits a hypnotic trill. Each non–frost worm creature within 100 feet must attempt a DC 32 Will save. The effects of Worm Trill last for 1 round, but if the frost worm uses this ability again on subsequent rounds, it extends this duration by 1 round for any creature already affected.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected and is immune to Worm Trill for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated} by the frost worm.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the {@condition fascinated} condition doesn't end if the frost worm uses {@condition hostile} actions against the creature.

bot.name: Worm Trill

entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} (plus {@condition slowed 1} for as long as it's {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

bot.requirements: The ghonhatine is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour
entries: The ghonhatine devours a chunk of the corpse. For 1 minute, the ghonhatine gains fast healing 5 and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls. It can gain these benefits from any given corpse only once.
bot.name: Feed
Fleshgout
bot.note: A ghonhatine's vomit carries an awful disease that, over time, can cause a suffering creature's flesh to develop painful boils that eventually slough away, leaving gaping wounds

entries: An amoeba swarm can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d4} acid, DC 17
bot.name: Constrict

bot.requirements: The giant amoeba begins its turn with a target its size or smaller {@condition grabbed}
entries: The giant amoeba maintains the Grab and extends pseudopods to surround the creature and pull it inside the amoeba's body. This thereafter has the same effect as if the amoeba had Engulfed the creature (DC 17, {@damage 1d6} acid, {@action Escape} DC 17, Rupture 3).
bot.name: Envelop

entries: An amoeba's acid damages only organic material—not metal, stone, or other inorganic substances.
bot.name: Weak Acid

bot.requirements: The giant ant has a Large or smaller creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The giant ant {@action Stride||Strides} up to its full Speed, carrying the {@condition grabbed} creature with it. It is {@condition encumbered} if the {@condition grabbed} creature is Medium or larger.
bot.name: Haul Away

entries: The giant badger enters a state of pure rage that lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls {@condition unconscious}, whichever comes first.

While raging, the giant badger has AC 17, its jaws {@action Strike} deals {@dice 1d8+8} damage, and its claw {@action Strike} deals {@dice 1d6+6} damage. While raging, the giant badger also can't use actions that have the {@trait concentrate} trait except for {@action Seek}.
After it has stopped raging, a giant badger can't use Badger Rage again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Badger Rage

entries: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to {@action Hide} with a {@skill Stealth} check.
top.name: Camouflage

entries: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue {@action Strike}, that creature becomes {@condition grabbed} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike} until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
bot.name: Tongue Grab

mid.trigger: The giant cockroach is targeted by a melee attack
entries: The giant cockroach gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the cockroach {@action Stride||Strides}, Climbs, or Flies up to 10 feet.
mid.name: Scurry

entries: If a creature critically succeeds on a check to {@action Trip} the giant crab, the crab is flipped over onto its back in addition to the usual effects. A giant crab that is flipped onto its back has a particularly hard time defending itself; instead of taking the normal –2 circumstance penalty to AC for being {@condition flat-footed}, it takes a –4 circumstance penalty to AC.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Prone

mid.trigger: A creature that the giant crab can see targets the crab with an attack
entries: The giant crab scuttles to the side and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. After the attack resolves, the crab can {@action Stride} up to its speed in a straight line as part of the reaction.
mid.name: Scuttle

entries: {@damage 1d6+4} bludgeoning, DC 18
bot.name: Constrict

mid.trigger: The giant crawling hand takes piercing or slashing damage
entries: A random creature adjacent to the giant crawling hand is sprayed with vile pus that deals {@damage 4d6} negative damage. The affected creature must attempt a DC 21 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and becomes {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and becomes {@condition sickened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and becomes {@condition sickened 3}.

mid.name: Pus Burst

entries: A crawling hand can be assigned a quarry by anointing the hand with a drop of the intended quarry's blood. If the hand ever has no quarry, it automatically gains the next creature it damages as its quarry. The hand gains a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks when it Seeks its quarry, to {@skill Survival} checks when it Tracks its quarry, and damage rolls when it {@action Strike||Strikes} its quarry.
bot.name: Mark Quarry

bot.requirements: The giant dragonfly has a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grabbed} in its mandibles
entries: The dragonfly tries to transfer the {@condition grabbed} creature to be clutched by its legs. The giant dragonfly attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, it transfers the creature (which remains {@condition grabbed}) to its legs, freeing its mandibles to attack. The dragonfly can have only one creature clutched at a time.
bot.name: Clutch

entries: The giant dragonfly can {@action Fly} at half Speed while it has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by Clutch, carrying that creature along with it.
bot.name: Snatch

entries: The giant dragonfly Flies up to its Speed and makes one mandible {@action Strike} at any point during that movement.
bot.name: Swoop

entries: The giant dragonfly nymph extends its jaws to a surprising distance. The dragonfly nymph makes a mandibles {@action Strike} with a reach of 10 feet, but the mandibles lose the {@trait agile} trait for this {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Extend Mandibles

mid.trigger: The giant fly is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see
entries: The giant fly gains a +2 circumstance bonus against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the giant insect can {@action Fly} up to its fly Speed.
mid.name: Avoid the Swat

bot.name: Fly Pox
bot.note: A giant fly could carry any disease, but most transmit a virulent but not fatal infection called {@action Fly} Pox with their bite

entries: Spear frogs are not {@condition flat-footed} when Balancing on a narrow surface, and they gain a +4 bonus to Reflex saves to avoid falling.
bot.name: Sticky Feet

entries: A creature hit by the giant frog's tongue becomes {@condition grabbed} by the giant frog. The creature isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the frog's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a {@action Strike} against AC 13 that deals at least 2 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the frog but prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike} until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
bot.name: Tongue Grab

entries: DC 28
mid.name: Buck

entries: The hippocampus makes a tail {@action Strike}, then Swims with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its swim Speed. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement.
bot.name: Sudden Retreat

entries: A giant jellyfish can fit into tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. It can move at its full Speed while {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}.
bot.name: Squeeze

bot.requirements: The giant leech has a creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained}
entries: The giant leech drains blood from the creature it has {@condition grabbed}. This deals {@dice 2d4} damage. A creature that has its blood {@condition drained} by a giant leech is {@condition drained 1} until it receives any kind or amount of healing.
bot.name: Blood Drain

mid.trigger: The giant maggot takes damage
entries: The giant maggot regurgitates its rancid, foul meal. All creatures in a 5-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 16 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} (or {@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure). The giant maggot can't use Regurgitation again until it spends at least an hour feeding on a corpse.
mid.name: Regurgitation

bot.requirements: The giant maggot has {@condition Grabbed} a creature
entries: The giant maggot deals {@damage 1d8+2} slashing damage to the {@condition grabbed} creature as it chews the creature's flesh (DC 19 basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Gnaw Flesh

attacks.name: proboscis
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+7} piercing plus Grab and septic malaria

bot.requirements: The giant mosquito has a creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The giant mosquito uses its proboscis to drain blood from the {@condition grabbed} creature. This deals {@dice 3d6} damage, and the giant mosquito gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood {@condition drained} by a giant mosquito is {@condition drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.
bot.name: Blood Drain
Septic Malaria
bot.note: The victim can't reduce its {@condition sickened} condition while it's affected by septic malaria

attacks.name: disgorged mucus
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6} acid damage plus mucus and {@damage 1d6} acid splash damage

entries: The giant slug can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed. It can {@action Squeeze} through spaces that typically fit only a Medium creature, but it does so at the usual Speed for {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}.
bot.name: Malleable

entries: Any creature hit by the giant slug or that moves into its mucus trail is coated in sticky, caustic mucus.
It takes {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent acid damage} and takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the damage persists.
bot.name: Mucus

entries: Any square the giant slug moves into is coated in mucus. These spaces are {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}, and any creature that moves into one or ends its turn in one is subjected to the slug's mucus. After an hour, the mucus dries and the area is no longer {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}.
bot.name: Mucus Trail

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 27
bot.name: Trample

entries: The giant snapping turtle can hold its breath for 2 hours.
top.name: Deep Breath

entries: The turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The turtle must succeed at a DC 35 {@skill Athletics} check (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the turtle) or the pilot's {@skill Lore||Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
bot.name: Capsize

entries: The snapping turtle retracts its limbs and head into its shell and ends its turn. This increases its AC to 30, but it can't act except to reemerge, which it can do as a single action.
bot.name: Shell Defense

entries: Large, {@damage 2d12+7} bludgeoning, Rupture 30.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The giant solifugid {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement.
If the giant solifugid began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after this ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: {@damage 1d10+10} bludgeoning, DC 25
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The giant squid moves up to 200 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering any reactions.
bot.name: Jet

entries: The giant squid makes up to four arm {@action Strike||Strikes}, each with a different arm and against a different target.
The giant squid then makes a beak {@action Strike} against one creature that it {@condition grabbed} during Ravenous Embrace.

Each arm {@action Strike} counts separately for the squid's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until the squid has made all of its arm {@action Strike||Strikes}; the beak {@action Strike} uses the multiple attack penalty as normal.
bot.name: Ravenous Embrace

entries: When the giant tick {@action Strike||Strikes} a creature larger than itself, its barbed hypostome attaches it to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the giant tick moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. The giant tick is {@condition flat-footed} while attached. If the giant tick is killed or pushed away while attached to a creature on which it has used Blood Drain, that creature takes 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}. Escaping the attachment or removing the giant tick in other ways doesn't cause bleed damage.
bot.name: Attach

bot.requirements: The giant tick is attached to a creature
entries: The giant tick uses its hypostome to drain blood from the creature it's attached to. This deals {@dice 1d4} damage, and the giant tick gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood {@condition drained} by a giant tick is {@condition drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).
bot.name: Blood Drain

entries: Any creature that hits the giant toad with an unarmed {@action Strike} or otherwise touches the toad is exposed to giant toad poison.
mid.name: Poisonous Warts

entries: Medium, {@damage 1d8+2} bludgeoning, Rupture 8.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A creature hit by the giant toad's tongue becomes {@condition grabbed} by the giant toad. The creature isn't {@condition immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the toad's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with a successful {@action Strike} against AC 15 that deals at least 6 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the toad but prevents it from using its tongue {@action Strike} until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.
bot.name: Tongue Grab

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The giant whiptail centipede {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Step||Steps}. During this movement, it can pass through spaces as narrow as 5 feet without {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}.
bot.name: Undulate

bot.requirements: The wolverine has a creature {@condition grabbed} from its jaws {@action Strike}
entries: The wolverine chews violently on the creature, dealing {@damage 2d6} piercing damage (DC 21 basic Fortitude save). A creature that fails its save also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Gnaw

entries: The wolverine {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the wolverine begins this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the attack.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: The giant wolverine enters a state of pure rage that lasts either for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls {@condition unconscious}, whichever comes first. While raging, the giant wolverine has AC 20, its jaws Strike deals {@damage 2d6+11} damage, and its claw Strike deals {@damage 2d4+11} damage. While raging, the giant wolverine can't use actions that have the {@trait concentrate} trait, except for {@action Seek}. After it's stopped raging, a giant wolverine can't use Wolverine Rage again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Wolverine Rage

entries: harmed by sonic ({@dice 6d6}, {@dice 2d6} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by fire (area {@dice 2d6} HP); {@condition slowed} by cold.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: A glass golem is affected by the {@spell shatter} spell as though the golem were an unattended object.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Shatter

mid.trigger: The glass golem is targeted by a spell
entries: The glass golem positions its magical, reflective surfaces to turn the spell back on the caster. It tries to counteract the spell by attempting an {@skill Acrobatics} check for its counteract check. If it successfully counteract the spell, the effect is turned back on the caster.
mid.name: Spell Reflection

entries: The glass golem creates waves of scintillating luminosity that cast bright light in a 60-foot emanation (and dim light for the next 60 feet). The light lasts until the start of the glass golem's next turn, after which the glass golem can't use Dazzling Brilliance for {@dice 1d4} rounds. A creature within the bright light or that enters the bright light must attempt a DC 23 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition blinded} for 1 round and then {@condition dazzled} for an additional 4 rounds.

bot.name: Dazzling Brilliance

entries: The gorgon breathes a 60-foot cone of green gas. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 25 Fortitude save. The gorgon can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature's body hardens and stiffens, causing it to become {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature becomes {@condition petrified} for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature becomes {@condition petrified} permanently.

bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The gorgon {@action Stride||Strides} twice, then makes a horn {@action Strike}. If it moved at least 20 feet from its starting position, the {@action Strike}'s damage is increased to {@dice 3d12+12}.
bot.name: Powerful Charge

entries: Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 26
bot.name: Trample

entries: The gosreg senses a creature's mental essence as a precise sense with the listed range; it cannot sense mindless creatures with thoughtsense.
top.name: Thoughtsense

entries: 30 feet. Gosregs project a field of discordant energy that unsettles the minds of thinking creatures. Any non-mindless creature within 30 feet of a gosreg takes a –1 status penalty to Will saves.
mid.name: Unsettled Aura

entries: The gosreg takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid.
This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: A gosreg concentrates its field of discordant mental energy and projects it into the mind of an enemy within 60 feet. The target takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage (DC 30 basic Will save). On a critical failure, the creature is also {@condition confused} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Mind Bolt

entries: A blow from a granite glyptodont's tail hardens the flesh of the creature struck. The target must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude saving throw or become {@condition slowed 1} (or {@condition slowed 2} on a critical failure). Further failed saves against calcification increase the value of the {@condition slowed} condition. Once a creature's actions are reduced to 0 by calcification, that creature becomes {@condition petrified}. If the creature isn't {@condition petrified}, the {@condition slowed} conditions end once 1 minute passes without the creature failing a save against calcification.

Every 24 hours after it was {@condition petrified}, the creature can attempt a DC 26 Fortitude save to recover. On a success, it becomes flesh again, but is {@condition slowed 1} for the next 24 hours. On a critical success, the creature recovers and isn't {@condition slowed}.
On a failure, the creature remains {@condition petrified}, but can try again in 24 hours.
On a critical failure, the petrification is permanent, and the creature can't attempt any more saves.
bot.name: Calcification

entries: A living boulder can {@action Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock.
When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: Fire elementals sometimes incorporate burning materials into their being, or possibly superheated materials such as molten rock or searing smoke.
bot.name: Elemental, Fire

entries: An amoeba swarm can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

top.trigger: A creature enters a space occupied by a gray ooze
top.requirements: Initiative has not yet been rolled
entries: The gray ooze automatically notices the creature, then makes a pseudopod {@action Strike} against one creature adjacent to itself before rolling initiative.
top.name: Puddled Ambush

entries: {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} acid, DC 21
bot.name: Constrict

entries: A gray ooze's acid damages only metal and organic materials, not stone.
bot.name: Gray Ooze Acid

entries: Grendel's hearing is a precise sense to a range of 120 feet.
top.name: Keen Hearing

entries: 60 feet, DC 38
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Grendel gains an extra reaction at the start of each of his turns that he can use only to make an {@action Attack of Opportunity} with his claw. He can't use more than one {@action Attack of Opportunity} triggered by the same action.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: Grendel would take {@condition persistent damage} or gain one of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition clumsy}, {@condition confused}, {@condition controlled}, {@condition dazzled}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition doomed}, {@condition drained}, {@condition enfeebled}, {@condition fascinated}, {@condition fatigued}, {@condition fleeing}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition sickened}, {@condition slowed}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition stupefied}
entries: The {@condition persistent damage} or condition from the triggering effect doesn't affect Grendel.
mid.name: Unstoppable

entries: Grendel's fist {@action Strike||Strikes} deal 18 bludgeoning damage on a failure (but no damage on a critical failure).
bot.name: Hands of the Murderer

bot.requirements: Grendel is grabbing a creature
entries: Grendel makes a bludgeoning jaws {@action Strike} against the creature he's grabbing. On a hit, the creature also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and becomes {@condition wounded 1}, or increases its {@condition wounded} value by 1 if already {@condition wounded}. On a critical hit, the creature instead becomes {@condition wounded 2}, or increases its {@condition wounded} value by 2 if already {@condition wounded}. If a creature dies from Tooth Grind, Grendel regains 40 HP; this is a {@trait healing} effect.
bot.name: Tooth Grind

entries: A grimstalker can {@action Hide} in natural environments, even if it doesn't have cover.
top.name: Camouflage

entries: A grimstalker can always find a path, almost as if foliage parts before it. A grimstalker ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede its progress.
bot.name: Woodland Stride

entries: A grindylow gains 1 extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an Attack of Opportunity with a tentacle. It can't use more than one Attack of Opportunity triggered by the same choice.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The {@condition grabbed} creature is not {@condition immobilized}, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it. If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is {@condition flat-footed} while it is attached to a creature.
bot.name: Clinging Suckers

entries: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.
bot.name: Jet

bot.requirements: The grippli is wielding a net in two hands
entries: The grippli makes a ranged {@action Strike} (with a +9 modifier) against a Medium or smaller creature within 20 feet. On a hit, the target is {@condition flat-footed} and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, the creature is {@condition restrained} instead. The DC to {@action Escape} the net is 16. A creature adjacent to the target can {@action Interact} with the net to remove it.
bot.name: Hurl Net

entries: Gripplis ignore {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} in forests and jungles.
bot.name: Jungle Stride

entries: When a grodair dies, its body explodes in a blast of pressurized water that deals {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures within a 15-foot emanation (DC 22 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is pushed 5 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).
mid.name: Death Flood

entries: The grodair transforms all soil, sand, or similar sediment in a 10-foot emanation into mud for 1 round. This mud is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for creatures other than grodairs.
bot.name: Muddy Field

entries: The grodair causes water to pour from a magical sac on its spine, either a stream of water at a rate of 1 gallon per round, or a fountain in a 5-foot-long stream at a rate of 5 gallons per round. It can stop the flow of water as a single action.
bot.name: Organ of Endless Water

entries: The gylou adopts the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid.

This doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage modifiers of their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but it might change the damage type their {@action Strike||Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Change Shape

bot.trigger: The gylou attempts a skill check but hasn't rolled yet
entries: The gylou demonstrates a preternatural ability for the task at hand. They use their {@skill Deception} modifier for the triggering check and for all skill checks using the same skill thereafter until the next time the gylou uses this ability or until 24 hours have passed, whichever happens first.
bot.name: Indispensable Savvy

bot.requirements: The gylou has a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The gylou transfers the {@condition grabbed} creature into their lower body's net of encaging tentacles, freeing their limbs and tentacles to make {@action Strike||Strikes}. This has the same effects as Swallow Whole (Medium, {@damage 2d12+12} bludgeoning, Rupture 30), except the encaged creature is not at risk of suffocation, and the gylou can bring the encaged creature with them when they cast {@spell dimension door}. A gylou can have only one creature encaged at a time.
bot.name: Tentacle Encage

entries: The hadrosaurid {@action Stride||Strides} twice. It has a +20-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these {@action Stride||Strides}.
bot.name: Sprint

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 21
bot.name: Trample

entries: Barb only. A hamatula gains an extra reaction at the start of each of its turns that it can use only to make an {@action Attack of Opportunity}. It can't use more than one {@action Attack of Opportunity} triggered by the same action. In addition to the normal trigger, a hamatula can make an {@action Attack of Opportunity} against a creature that touches it or an adjacent creature that attempts a melee {@action Strike} against it.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: On a critical hit, the hamatula's barbs deal {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Bloodletting

bot.trigger: The hamatula hits a creature with a barb {@action Strike}
entries: The creature struck must succeed at a DC 27 Will save or become {@condition frightened 2} (or {@condition frightened 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of its saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to Frightful {@action Strike} for 24 hours.
bot.name: Frightful Strike

entries: The hamatula makes a barb {@action Strike}, then {@action Stride||Strides} up to half its Speed without triggering reactions. If the {@action Strike} hits, the hamatula impales the target with one of its barbs and snaps the barb free as it moves away from the target. This deals an additional {@damage 2d8} piercing damage to the target and pins it to an adjacent surface, rendering it {@condition immobilized} ({@action Escape} DC 29).
bot.name: Impaling Barb

entries: A hamatula's glyph of warding innate spell can contain any common spell from the Core Rulebook that meets the criteria in glyph of warding; the hamatula doesn't need to provide the spell.
bot.name: Warden of Erebus

mid.trigger: The hellcat begins its turn in bright light
entries: The hellcat becomes {@condition invisible} until its no longer in bright light. If the hellcat uses a {@condition hostile} action, the invisibility ends after that {@condition hostile} action is completed.
mid.name: Fade into the Light

entries: The hellcat deals an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition frightened} creatures.
bot.name: Fearful Attack

entries: The hellcat telepathically link its senses to all other hellcats within 100 feet for 10 minutes. It loses this contact with any hellcat that moves out of a 100-foot radius. While linked to at least one ally, the hellcat can't be flanked and gains a +2 status bonus to Will saving throws.
bot.name: Infernal Mindlink

entries: The hellcat produces a low growl to disorient and frighten foes. The hellcat can cause this vocalization to originate from somewhere else within 30 feet. Non-fiends in a 15-foot burst must attempt a DC 25 Will save. The hellcat can't issue another Menacing Growl for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 4}.

bot.name: Menacing Growl

entries: The hellcat {@action Stride||Strides} and makes a {@action Strike} at the end of that movement. If the hellcat began this action {@condition hidden}, it remains {@condition hidden} until after the ability's {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Pounce

entries: A hezrou revels in the foulness it exudes and becomes distraught when contaminations are purified. The first time in a round when a contamination is purified (such as via purify food and drink) or a toxin is neutralized (such as via neutralize poison) within 30 feet of a hezrou, the demon takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage.
mid.name: Purity Vulnerability

entries: 30 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 27 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1} (plus {@condition slowed 1} for as long as its {@condition sickened} on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the {@condition sickened} condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Stench

bot.requirements: The hezrou is grappling a creature
entries: Toxic fluids spurt from burst boils and weeping wens on the hezrou's body. A creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} by the hezrou takes {@damage 2d12+6} poison damage (DC 30 basic Fortitude save).
bot.name: Poisonous Pustules

entries: DC 17
mid.name: Buck

entries: The hippocampus makes a tail {@action Strike}, then Swims with a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its swim Speed. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement.
bot.name: Sudden Retreat

entries: DC 17
mid.name: Buck

entries: The hippogriff Flies up to its fly speed and makes two talon {@action Strike||Strikes} at any point during that movement. Each {@action Strike} must target a different creature. The attacks take the normal multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Flying Strafe

entries: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 5 minutes.
top.name: Deep Breath

entries: 30 feet
bot.name: Aquatic Ambush

entries: The hippopotamus tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The hippopotamus must succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check with a DC of 25 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the hippo) or the pilot's {@skill Lore|Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
bot.name: Capsize

entries: Medium or smaller, foot, DC 23
bot.name: Trample

entries: A hodag sweeps the ground behind it with its tail as it moves, obscuring its tracks. The DCs of checks to {@action Track} a hodag are increased by 10.
top.name: Trackless

entries: The hodag makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one jaws {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Rip and Tear

entries: The hodag {@action Stride||Strides}, then makes a {@action Strike} against a target in reach. If it moves at least 20 feet and succeeds at its {@action Strike}, the hodag deals damage normally and then attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the creature's Fortitude DC to toss the enemy into the air. On a success, the tossed creature is thrown <10 feet> in a straight line in the direction of the hodag's choice and then lands {@condition prone}. If the creature is knocked into a solid object, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage as well before landing {@condition prone}. The hodag can instead toss a creature straight up in the air. The creature lands in the same square where it started, takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage, and lands {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Toss

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, the archon can use dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either creature used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: A hound archon can take the appearance of any canid animal of Small to Large size. This doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for their {@action Strike||Strikes}, but if the canid's bite attack has the Knockdown ability, then the hound archon's bite attack gains that ability while they are in that form.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The hound archon carefully makes one greatsword {@action Strike} and one jaws {@action Strike} in any order. These attacks count toward the hound archon's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.
bot.name: Diligent Assault

entries: Whenever a creature targets the hound with a {@trait mental} effect, that creature takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage (DC 25 basic Will save). On a critical failure, it also becomes {@condition confused} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Otherworldly Mind

entries: 30 feet. The hound of Tindalos's eyes glow balefully, causing painful but bloodless wounds to rip open in the body of a creature that meets its awful gaze. When a creature ends its turn in the aura's emanation, it takes {@damage 4d6} slashing damage (DC 25 basic Fortitude save). A creature that critically succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
mid.name: Ripping Gaze

entries: When a hound of Tindalos is not adjacent to a structural angle of 90o (or more acute), its resistance to physical damage is suppressed and it becomes {@condition sickened 1}. It can't recover from this {@condition sickened} condition, but the condition ends automatically once the hound is again adjacent to a suitable angle.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Curved Space

entries: The hound of Tindalos casts a 4th-level {@spell dimension door} spell, but it must transport itself into a space adjacent to an angle of 90o (or more acute) in the structure or environment around it. For example, it could teleport to a space adjacent to a wall (using the angle between the wall and floor) or a corner in a room, or adjacent to a sizable tree growing straight up out of the ground, but not to a flat plain or a room with only curved corners and edges.
Once per day, the hound can use this ability to plane shift to or from the Dimension of Time, with the same restrictions on what angles it can appear next to.
bot.name: Angled Entry

entries: harmed by fire ({@dice 4d6}, {@dice 1d10} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by cold (area {@dice 1d6} HP); {@condition slowed} by water.
mid.name: Golem Antimagic

entries: When an ice golem is destroyed, its body explodes in a blast of frigid air and razor-sharp ice, dealing {@damage 2d6} slashing damage and {@damage 2d6} cold damage to creatures in a 20-foot emanation, with a DC 19 basic Reflex save.
mid.name: Icy Demise

entries: An ice golem can be targeted with endure elements even if it's not willing. If it is targeted, for 1 round it can't use Breath Weapon or benefit from creeping cold, and its fist attack doesn't deal cold damage.
mid.name: Vulnerable to Endure Elements

entries: The ice golem exhales a blast of freezing mist that deals {@damage 6d6} cold damage in a 30-foot cone (DC 22 basic Reflex save). It can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: When the ice golem gets a critical hit with a fist {@action Strike}, the target also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent cold damage} and is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
bot.name: Creeping Cold

entries: The ice mephit breathes shards of ice in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 1d6} cold damage and {@damage 1d6} piercing damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The ice mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

abilities: fast healing 2 (while touching ice or snow)

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+16} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} cold and frozen strike

mid.trigger: The ice yai is targeted by a ranged {@action Strike} or spell attack roll that doesn't have the {@trait fire} trait
entries: The ice yai creates a reflective blockade of ice, gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack roll. If the attack misses, the ice yai redirects the attack to another creature within 20 feet of the yai. The attacker rerolls the attack roll against the new target.
mid.name: Icy Deflection

entries: The ice yai takes on the appearance of an {@creature frost giant}. This doesn't change their Speed or {@action Strike} attack and damage.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The ice yai makes two fist {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Double Punch

entries: On a critical hit with a fist {@action Strike} or a hit with an ice missile {@action Strike}, the target creature must attempt a DC 33 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition slowed 2} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition slowed 3} for 1 round.

bot.name: Frozen Strike

entries: When the icewyrm dies, it explodes, dealing {@damage 8d6} cold damage to each creature in a 10-foot emanation (DC 27 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Explosion

entries: The icewyrm breathes a 60-foot line of freezing shards of razor-sharp ice, dealing {@damage 3d12} cold damage and {@damage 3d12} piercing damage to every creature in the line (DC 29 basic Reflex save). The icewyrm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The icewyrm can {@action Burrow} through ice or snow with a Speed of 20 feet. It moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Ice Burrow

entries: Until the next time it acts, the icicle snake appears to be an unassuming icicle. It has an automatic result of 27 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as an icicle.
bot.name: Icicle

attacks.name: lesser alchemist's fire
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d8} fire plus 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} and 1 fire splash damage

entries: An ifrit pyrochemist carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time the pyrochemist makes their daily preparations: lesser alchemist's fire (5), lesser elixir of life (2), lesser smokestick.
top.name: Infused Items

entries: The ifrit pyrochemist draws an alchemical bomb with an {@action Interact} action and throws it as a ranged {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Quick Bomber

entries: The iguanodon makes a thumb spike {@action Strike} at an adjacent foe and then {@action Stride||Strides} up to 15 feet, dragging its thumb spike across the foe to gouge out a brutal wound. If this {@action Strike} hits, it deals an extra {@dice 1d8} points of slashing damage and the following {@action Stride} does not trigger reactions from the creature struck. This thumb spike {@action Strike} counts as two attacks when calculating the iguanodon's multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Gouging Lunge

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+11} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} chaotic and warpwave strike

entries: An akizendri can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the akizendri the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. A creature under the effects of nondetection or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.
top.name: Entropy Sense

entries: An akizendri's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the akizendri takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The akizendri is immune to {@trait polymorph} effects unless it is a willing target. If {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}, the akizendri automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.
mid.name: Protean Anatomy

entries: The imentesh takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its {@action Strike||Strikes}, but might change the damage type its {@action Strike||Strikes} deal.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: {@damage 1d10+11} bludgeoning, DC 29
bot.name: Constrict

entries: An imentesh inflicts a warpwave on a creature within 100 feet (page 204; (DC 29 Fortitude save to resist).
bot.name: Inflict Warpwave

entries: An imentesh's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} targets.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: Any creature struck and damaged by an imentesh's jaws {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave (page 204).
bot.name: Warpwave Strike

entries: The intellect devourer reduces in size and burrows into the brain of a creature dead for no longer than 1 day.

At the start of the intellect devourer's next turn, the body revives at its maximum Hit Points, {@condition controlled} by the devourer. The intellect devourer is conscious and can sense everything the possessed body could. Any effect that ends the possession kills the host body with the same effects as Exit Body. The intellect devourer can't use any of the host creature's spells with Body Thief but can use its own spells. The host body slowly decays while inhabited by the intellect devourer, becoming uninhabitable after 7 days unless preserved with gentle repose or a similar effect.
bot.name: Body Thief

bot.requirements: The intellect devourer is controlling a body with Body Thief
entries: The intellect devourer leaves its host body, which dies instantly and is no longer a suitable host for any Body Thief ability. The intellect devourer appears at full size in an adjacent space.
bot.name: Exit Body

entries: The intellect devourer makes two talon {@action Strike||Strikes} against a {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition unconscious} creature, using the same attack modifier as its highest attack modifier. These {@action Strike||Strikes} gain the {@trait death} trait. If Ravage kills the target, the intellect devourer may use Body Thief against it as a free action.
bot.name: Ravage

entries: While an intellect devourer uses Body Thief, it gains the ability to understand and speak all languages known by the host, as well as knowledge of the host body's abilities, identity, role in society, and personality. However, it does not gain the specific memories or knowledge of the host body.
bot.name: Stolen Identity

spells.name: to the Material Plane or Shadow
