entries: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the {@condition doomed}, {@condition dying}, and {@condition wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.
top.name: Painsight

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees pieces of its own body amid the interlocutor's form. The creature must succeed at a DC 29 Will save or become {@condition stunned 1}.
mid.name: Glimpse of Stolen Flesh

entries: The interlocutor stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against glimpse of stolen flesh. In addition, if the creature was already {@condition stunned}, on a failed save, it feels its internal organs twist and writhe, and is {@condition clumsy 2} for 1 minute. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the interlocutor's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

entries: This functions as the Rend ability, dealing claw damage. In addition, if the target is a living creature with organs and muscle, the interlocutor opens a precise wound.
Until the creature is restored to its maximum Hit Points, thus closing the wound, {@action Strike||Strikes} against the creature deal {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage.
bot.name: Surgical Rend

entries: If an invidiak attempts to possess a creature and the creature rolls a critical success on its saving throw to resist possession, or if an invidiak's possession of a creature is ended prematurely, such as via a successful dispel magic, the invidiak takes {@damage 6d6} mental damage and cannot use possession for 24 hours.
mid.name: Exorcism Vulnerability

entries: Each invidiak has a particular type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from the following list: aberration, animal, beast, or any humanoid (such as dwarf)—in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak uses possession against a favored host, the duration of possession increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it.
bot.name: Favored Host

entries: The invidiak {@action Stride||Strides} up to twice their speed. If the invidiak ends their movement in an area of dim light, they become {@condition hidden} as long as they don't move and the lighting in the area they're in doesn't grow brighter than dim light.
bot.name: Shadow Blend

entries: An invidiak leaves no body behind when using possession.
bot.name: Unbodied Possession

entries: The irlgaunt violently regurgitates a melonsized clot of brittle stone supernaturally infused with digestive enzymes. The stone and acid explode on impact within a range of 30 feet, dealing {@damage 7d6} piercing damage and {@damage 7d6} acid damage to creatures in a 20-foot burst (DC 33 basic Reflex save). The irlgaunt can't Regurgitate Gastroliths for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Regurgitate Gastrolith

entries: The irlgaunt ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} composed of rocks and stone.
bot.name: Stone Step

entries: A non-evil creature hit by an irnakurse's tentacle is overwhelmed with corrupted images of a ruined life and must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or be {@condition stunned 2} (or {@condition stunned 4} on a critical failure). After attempting this save, a creature is temporarily immune to Mind Lash for 24 hours.
bot.name: Mind Lash

entries: The irnakurse unleashes an alien shriek of nightmarish horror and pain. All non-evil creatures within a 10-foot emanation must attempt a DC 28 Will save. The irnakurse can.
bot.name: Soul Scream

entries: Scream for up to 6 rounds; each time it does, it repeats the effect.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected, and is temporarily immune to Soul Scream for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stupefied 1}. Further failed saves against Soul Scream increase the condition value by 1, to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}. Each time the character gets a full night's rest, the {@condition stupefied} condition gained from Soul Scream decreases by 1.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, except the {@condition stupefied} value increases by 2 instead of by 1.

bot.name: Sustain Soul

entries: The irnakurse makes up to four tentacle {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the irnakurse's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all of its attacks.
bot.name: Storm of Tentacles

entries: An isqulug can precisely sense any creature infected with isqulugia within 30 feet, and knows the current stage of the disease.
top.name: Host Scent

entries: The isqulug expels larvae from the hivemind in its head in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in this area take {@damage 6d10} piercing damage as the swarm feeds on their flesh (DC 30 basic Reflex save). Any creature that takes damage is exposed to isqulugia.
The isqulug becomes {@condition stupefied 1} for {@dice 1d4} rounds, during which it can't Expel Infestation.
bot.name: Expel Infestation
Isqulugia
bot.note: Isqulugia's {@condition sickened}, {@condition slowed}, and {@condition paralyzed} conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed

stages.entry: the creature dies, and its body violently transforms into a new isqulug.

entries: The isqulug can {@action Squeeze} through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, it can move at its full Speed. The isqulug can even {@action Squeeze} through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}.
bot.name: Malleability

entries: An isqulug ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} that's caused by typical features of swamps.
bot.name: Swamp Stride

entries: The jabberwock always treats the plane it is currently located on as its home plane.
top.name: Planar Acclimation

entries: 100 feet, DC 43
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: A jabberwock damaged by a vorpal weapon becomes {@condition frightened 2} (or {@condition frightened 4} on a critical hit).
mid.name: Vorpal Fear

mid.trigger: A creature within the jabberwock's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, leaves a square during a move action, makes a ranged attack, or uses a concentrate action
entries: The jabberwock makes a claw {@action Strike} against the triggering creature. If the {@action Strike} hits, the jabberwock disrupts the triggering action.
mid.name: Claws That Catch

entries: The jabberwock creates a blast of strange noises and shouted nonsense in the various languages it knows (and invariably some languages it doesn't know), creating one of two effects. The jabberwock can't Burble again for 1d4 rounds.

items: {@bold Confusion} (aura, emotion, enchantment, mental, primal) 60 feet. Each creature in the emanation must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or become confused for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

{@bold Sonic Beam} (evocation, primal, sonic) The jabberwock focuses its Burbling into a 60 foot line of sonic energy that deals {@damage 24d6} sonic damage to creatures in the area (DC 46 basic Reflex save).

bot.name: Burble

entries: If the jabberwock makes a jaws attack and rolls a natural 19 on the d20 roll, the attack is a critical hit. This has no effect if the 19 would be a failure.
bot.name: Jaws That Bite

bot.trigger: The jabberwock Flies or makes a wing {@action Strike};
entries: The jabberwock's wings whiffle, creating severe winds within a 30-foot emanation. These winds move outward from the jabberwock, and they persist until the start of the jabberwock's next turn. During this time, flight of any kind in the emanation requires a successful DC 43 {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Maneuver in Flight}, and creatures flying toward the jabberwock are moving through greater difficult terrain. Creatures on the ground in the emanation must succeed at a DC 43 {@skill Athletics} check to approach the jabberwock.
bot.name: Whiffling

entries: A jotund troll ordinarily has nine heads, and they can use regeneration to regrow a head that is severed from an effect like a vorpal weapon. After regaining Hit Points from regeneration, the jotund troll attempts a DC {@flatDC 8} flat check. On a success, one missing head is fully restored; on a critical success, two missing heads are fully restored. If a jotund troll loses their last remaining head, they die immediately.
mid.name: Head Regrowth

entries: A jotund troll gains an extra reaction per round for each of their heads beyond the first, which they can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity with their jaws or to Fast Swallow. They can't use more than 1 reaction for the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares within their reach, and the jotund troll must use a different head for each {@action Attack of Opportunity} they make. Whenever one of the jotund troll's heads is severed, the troll loses 1 of their extra reactions per round.
mid.name: Multiple Opportunities

entries: The jotund troll emits a cacophonous roar from all their heads with a mystical power that distorts the listener's mind. Each non-troll creature within 100 feet must attempt a DC 34 Will save. The jotund troll can't use Cacophonous Roar for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Cacophonous Roar for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition confused} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition confused} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Cacophonous Roar

bot.trigger: The jotund troll Grabs a creature with their jaws
entries: The troll uses {@ability Swallow Whole}.
bot.name: Fast Swallow

entries: The jotund troll makes a number of jaws {@action Strike||Strikes} up to their number of heads, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the troll's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the jotund troll makes all of these attacks.
bot.name: Ravenous Jaws

entries: Medium, {@damage 3d12+8} bludgeoning, Rupture 36.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: Positive {@trait healing} effects always heal the jyoti for the maximum amount. It doesn't gain the automatic Hit Points or temporary Hit Points from being on a plane with the positive planar essence.
mid.name: Positive Energy Affinity

entries: The jyoti breathes a blast of searing flame infused with positive energy in a 40-foot cone that deals {@damage 8d6} fire damage plus {@damage 4d6} positive damage to creatures in the area (DC 28 basic Reflex save)
The jyoti can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: Any weapon a jyoti wields becomes a flaming {@item ghost touch} weapon while the jyoti holds it.
bot.name: Infuse Weapons

entries: The kelpie instills an overwhelming attraction to itself within the mind of a single creature within 60 feet. The target perceives the kelpie as a desirable person (if the kelpie is in humanoid form) or a valuable steed (if the kelpie is in equine form) and must attempt a DC 23 Will saving throw.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Captivating Lure for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 round and is then temporarily immune to Captivating Lure for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the kelpie as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the kelpie, it either attempts to mount the kelpie (if the kelpie is in equine form) or stays still and doesn't act. If the creature is attacked by the kelpie, or if it can't breathe water and enters an area of water, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the kelpie's turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the target doesn't consider water a danger and will enter an area of water even if it can't swim or breathe water. If it is attacked by the kelpie or starts to drown, it can attempt a new save at the start of its next turn, but it isn't freed automatically.

bot.name: Captivating Lure

entries: The kelpie can take on the appearance of any Medium or Large animal of an equine nature (such as a horse, hippocampus, or pony), or any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speeds or its attack and damage modifiers with its {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: 5 feet.

The korred's long, animated hair reaches out and interferes with creatures in the area. The korred can select which targets are affected by their animated hair. An affected creature that ends its turn in the emanation must succeed at a DC 18 Reflex save or become {@condition clumsy 1} ({@condition clumsy 2} on a critical failure) as long as it remains in the aura.
mid.name: Animated Hair

entries: The korred causes a long, tangled length of their hair to detach from their body and snake out to coil around an adjacent creature. The creature must attempt a DC 21 Reflex save. The korred cannot use Hair Snare again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The hair wraps around the creature. The creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to all of its Speeds until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 21) or until the korred uses Hair Snare again (at which point the previous snare drops to the ground, no longer animated).
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition immobilized} until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 21) or the korred uses Hair Snare again.

bot.name: Hair Snare

entries: Frequency three times per day; The korred unleashes an otherworldly laugh. Each non-fey creature within a 30-foot burst must attempt a DC 21 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round (or {@condition stunned 1} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Otherworldly Laugh

entries: The korred steps into a block of stone large enough for them to fit inside and instantly teleports to any other stone within 30 feet that has the same minimum size. Once the korred enters the stone, they instantly know the rough locations of other sufficiently large stones within 30 feet.

They can exit from the original stone, if they prefer. They can't carry extradimensional spaces with them when they Stone {@action Stride}; if the korred attempts to do so, Stone {@action Stride} fails.
bot.name: Stone Stride

entries: While touching its webs, the Leng spider has precise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Greater Web Sense

entries: The Leng spider creates a weapon by applying a cord of webbing to heavy objects, such as rocks or chunks of metal, either attaching two heavy objects together to create a web bola or fastening one to its leg to create a web war flail.
bot.name: Create Web Weaponry

entries: The Leng spider moves straight down up to 120 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count when calculating falling damage. The web can be severed by a {@action Strike} that deals slashing damage (AC 30, Hardness 15, 25 HP), causing the Leng spider to fall.
bot.name: Descend on a Web

entries: Frequency three times per day; The Leng spider spins a web within 20 feet of itself to create a grasping snare, stunning snare, or warning snare. The Leng spider's web provides all the raw materials it needs. All save and {@action Escape} DCs associated with web traps use the Leng spider's {@skill Crafting} DC for traps (DC 36). A web trap decays after 24 hours.
bot.name: Lay Web Trap

entries: The leprechaun produces an item out of their hat, from behind their jacket, from within a hole in a tree stump, or from any other unexpected location. This conjured item must be no more than 1 Bulk and must be made of relatively commonplace material (such as cloth, wood, stone, or even low-value metal like iron or lead). It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a Cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher. The created object is temporary and lasts for 1 hour or until the leprechaun creates a new item, whichever comes first.
bot.name: Create Object

entries: When a leprechaun uses their innate spells to deceive, trick, or humiliate a creature, the spell DC increases to 20 and the attack modifier to +11.
bot.name: Leprechaun Magic

attacks.name: warhammer
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d12+18} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d10+18} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}

spells.name: plane shift
notes: to the {@place Material Plane}, {@place Plane of Fire}, or {@place Plane of Earth} only

entries: 100 feet. Creatures in the emanation cannot recover from {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}.
mid.name: Tenacious Flames

entries: A lerritan can break stony scales off its body to throw; these scales reform at the end of each round, so the lerritan is never without a supply of rocks to hurl.
bot.name: Throw Rock

entries: The volcano on the lerritan's back erupts and sends lava bombs raining down in a 30-foot emanation, dealing {@damage 12d12} fire damage.

Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 46 Reflex saving throw. The lava globules quickly cool into heavy stones, transforming the area into {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} for non-lerritans. The lerritan can't use Volcanic Eruption for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition encumbered} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition immobilized} ({@action Escape} DC 46).
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is encased in a rocky crust with lava on the inside. The creature is {@condition restrained} ({@action Escape} DC 46), can't breathe, takes {@damage 3d12} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}, and can't recover from this {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} until freed.

bot.name: Volcanic Eruption

entries: A leucrotta can learn any language it hears spoken for at least 10 minutes, adding it to its languages known and replacing the language it previously learned using this ability. Typically, a leucrotta knows Gnoll as the language granted by this ability.
top.name: Language Adaptation

entries: 60 feet; The leucrotta utters a plaintive cry to draw its prey closer. Each creature within the emanation that was deceived by Sound Mimicry must succeed at a DC 19 Will save or become {@condition fascinated} and compelled to move toward the sound of the leucrotta's voice on their turn. {@condition Fascinated} creatures are also {@condition flat-footed}. If the attacks, the {@condition fascinated} condition ends only for the creature that is attacked.

If the leucrotta speaks a creature's name while using its Luring Cry, that creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to their saving throw to resist the ability. On a successful save, a creature is temporarily immune to Luring Cry for 24 hours.
bot.requirements: The leucrotta's last action was Sound Mimicry
bot.name: Luring Cry

entries: The leucrotta perfectly imitates voices and speech and attempts a {@skill Deception} check against listeners' Will DC to fool them. The leucrotta gains a +4 bonus to this {@skill Deception} check if it has listened to the creature it's imitating for at least 10 minutes at any point in the last 24 hours. The leucrotta can't duplicate voice-based abilities or spells, though it can perfectly mimic the sound of verbal spellcasting and can attempt to deceive constructs or undead that respond to voice commands. The leucrotta can't imitate speech in languages it doesn't know.
bot.name: Sound Mimicry

entries: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.
top.name: Magic Sense

mid.trigger: A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell
entries: The leydroth attempts an {@skill Intimidation} check to counteract the triggering spell.
mid.name: Menace to Magic

entries: The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a 30-foot emanation. It rolls an {@skill Intimidation} check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of {@action Demoralize}. It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or {@trait magical} effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of dispel magic. The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Dispelling Roar

bot.trigger: The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a {@action Strike}
entries: The leydroth casts its innate dispel magic, targeting one effect on the creature struck.
bot.name: Dispelling Strike

entries: Any time a leydroth counteracts a spell or item, the spell's caster or the creature holding the item takes {@damage 8d6} mental damage (DC 38 basic Will save).
bot.name: Spell Feedback

entries: A living boulder can {@action Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock.
When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: The living boulder {@action Stride||Strides} twice, and can then make a {@action Strike} with its jaws. This jaws {@action Strike} gains Knockdown.
bot.name: Rolling Charge

entries: The living thunderclap doesn't trigger reactions when it moves.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: The living thunderclap emits a bolt of lightning that crashes with deafening thunder. The living thunderclap makes a lightning bolt {@action Strike} that deals {@damage 1d12} electricity damage. If it hits, the target and any creatures within a 15-foot emanation around the target take {@damage 2d6} sonic damage and must attempt a DC 18 basic Fortitude save. Any creature that fails its save is also {@condition deafened} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Thunderbolt

entries: The lunar naga twists the coils of their serpentine body, causing the starlike motes on their scales to shift and move as they glow brighter, creating a mesmerizing swirl of light and darkness. All creatures within a 30-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition fascinated} until the end of the naga's next turn (on a critical failure, {@condition fascinated} creatures drop whatever items they are carrying as well). The lunar naga can {@action Sustain a Spell} on Hypnosis. If the naga moves, affected creatures are compelled to remain within 30 feet of the naga and must spend each of its actions moving closer to the naga as expediently as possible on its next turn. If a creature is unable to end its turn within 30 feet of the naga, the effect ends for that creature.
bot.name: Hypnosis

bot.note: Once a creature falls {@condition unconscious} from lunar naga venom, they remain asleep for {@dice 1d8} hours unless woken.
bot.name: Lunar Naga Venom

spells.name: dimension door
notes: and only to an area in bright light

entries: A creature that takes damage from a lurker in light's mote of light must attempt a DC 22 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to lurker's glow for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature is lined in golden light for 1 minute and can't be {@condition concealed} during this time. If the creature becomes {@condition invisible}, it is {@condition concealed} rather than being {@condition undetected}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature sheds bright light in a 20-foot emanation for the duration of the effect. In addition, the creature is {@condition dazzled} on its first turn after failing this save.

bot.name: Lurker's Glow

bot.requirements: The lurker in light has reduced a living creature to 0 Hit Points on this turn or its previous turn and has a summon fey innate spell available
entries: The lurker in light casts summon fey with only a verbal component, using the act of slaughter to replace the normal material and somatic components for the spell. If the fey creature summoned has the same alignment as the lurker in light, the lurker in light can sustain the {@spell summon fey} spell for up to 1 hour instead of 1 minute.
bot.name: Ritual Gate

entries: A lurker in light's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: pincer
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+9} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire} and Grab

attacks.name: tail sting
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+9} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire} and magma scorpion venom

entries: The magma scorpion ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: Mephits are small, weak creatures that serve at the whims of other elemental entities.
The mephits presented here are less common than air mephits, earth mephits, and the like, as they are a blend of two different elements rather than focusing on one alone.
bot.name: Elemental, Mephit

entries: A mandragora can smell creatures with blood as an imprecise sense at a range of 30 feet, and it can smell demons, fey, and sorcerers with blood as a precise sense at a range of 30 feet.
top.name: Blood Scent

entries: Whenever a mandragora begins its turn in an area of magical darkness, it is {@condition slowed 1} on that turn.
mid.name: Vulnerability to Supernatural Darkness

bot.requirements: The mandragora has a creature {@condition grabbed}
entries: The mandragora drains blood from the creature it has {@condition grabbed}, dealing {@dice 2d6} damage. If the creature is a demon, fey, or sorcerer, the mandragora gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature that has its blood {@condition drained} by a mandragora is {@condition drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.
bot.name: Blood Drain

entries: Frequency once per day; The mandragora emits an unsettling shriek.
Each non-mandragora creature within 30 feet must attempt a DC 25 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 2} and {@condition slowed 1}. As long as the creature remains {@condition sickened}, this {@condition slowed} condition value can't be reduced below 1.

bot.name: Piercing Shriek

entries: A stingray in water can use its electrolocation as an imprecise sense at the listed range to detect living creatures that are in the same body of water as itself.
top.name: Electrolocation

entries: The manta ray Swims twice. It has a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed during these actions.
bot.name: Swift Swimmer

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+14} slashing plus {@damage 3d6} fire and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire}

spells.name: tree shape
notes: appears as a burnt, dead tree

entries: 30 feet.
A creature that enters or begins its turn in this aura's emanation must attempt a DC 33 Will save. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 hour.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature loses any resistance to fire for 1 hour and gains weakness 15 to fire for the same duration.

mid.name: Fascination of Flame

mid.trigger: The marrmora is targeted by a fire spell or effect, or is in the area of a {@trait fire} effect
entries: The marrmora is healed by the fire damage, regaining Hit Points equal to half the damage the {@trait fire} effect would have dealt.
mid.name: Absorb Flame

bot.requirements: The marrmora is not under the effect of fire shield
entries: The marrmora makes a claw {@action Strike}. If it hits, it can immediately cast one of its available fire shield innate spells as a free action.
bot.name: Igniting Assault

bot.requirements: A creature adjacent to the marsh giant is {@condition prone} in water at least 1 foot deep
entries: The marsh giant uses its gaff to shake the creature back and forth and hold it underwater. The giant attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the target's Fortitude DC.

entries.Critical Success: The target takes {@damage 6d6+14} piercing damage and loses 5 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.
entries.Success: The target takes {@damage 3d6+14} piercing damage and loses 3 rounds' worth of air if they were holding their breath.
entries.Failure: The target is unaffected.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the giant drops its gaff as well.

bot.name: Hook Shake

entries: The marsh giant makes a melee {@action Strike} with its gaff. If it hits, it twists and yanks the gaff to create an awful wound, dealing {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to the creature.
bot.name: Twist the Hook

attacks.name: fist
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+11} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} lawful and fists of thunder and lightning

entries: A zelekhut can speak with and understand any creature with a language.
top.name: Truespeech

entries: The marut is anathema to beings that unnaturally extend their existence, including undead. Its fists bypass such creatures' resistances to damage and apply the creatures' highest weakness to damage. If a marut kills a creature that rejuvenates, like a lich or ghost, it always knows that the creature isn't fully defeated.
bot.name: Final End

entries: Each time the marut makes a fist {@action Strike}, it chooses either lightning or thunder. If it chooses lightning, the attack deals an additional {@damage 2d12} electricity damage and the target must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. If it chooses thunder, the attack deals an additional {@damage 3d8} sonic damage and the target must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
bot.name: Fists of Thunder and Lightning

entries: The mastodon makes two tusk {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different creature. This counts as one attack for the mastodon's multiple attack penalty, and the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
bot.name: Dual Tusks

entries: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the mastodon's trunk is {@condition grabbed}. If the mastodon moves, it can bring the {@condition grabbed} creature along with it.
bot.name: Grabbing Trunk

entries: Large or smaller, foot, DC 27
bot.name: Trample

entries: Large, {@damage 2d10+7} bludgeoning, Rupture 16.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+13} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} evil, Grab, and withering touch

entries: 20 feet. A meladaemon emanates an aura of intense hunger. Each round a creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 27 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} negative damage ({@dice 2d6} on a critical failure) and becomes {@condition fatigued}. This fatigue ends as soon as the creature eats any food.
mid.name: Consumptive Aura

mid.trigger: The meladaemon is attacked by an adjacent creature and the attack misses
entries: The meladaemon swipes at the triggering creature, which must immediately attempt a save against the meladaemon's withering touch.
mid.name: Withering Opportunity

entries: When the meladaemon hits with a claw {@action Strike} or a creature begins its turn {@condition grabbed} by the meladaemon, the creature must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save.
On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} negative damage and becomes {@condition fatigued}. This fatigue ends when the creature drinks.
bot.name: Withering Touch

mid.trigger: A {@condition hostile} creature within 30 feet creates an effect with the {@trait auditory} trait that provides bonuses to itself or its allies
entries: The melody on the wind recreates the {@trait auditory} effect, gaining the bonuses for itself and its allies as long as the original effect persists.
mid.name: Hostile Duet

mid.trigger: The melody on the wind is targeted by a spell with the {@trait auditory} trait
entries: The melody on the wind attempts to counteract the spell. If it succeeds, the spell effect is caught in a blast of wind that sweeps it back to its origin, affecting the caster. Targets of the triggering effect other than the melody on the wind are still affected normally.
mid.name: Retune

entries: The melody on the wind sings in a sonorous chorus. Any creature in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a DC 30 Will save to resist becoming {@condition fascinated} by the melody on the wind. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition fascinated} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Mesmerizing Melody

entries: The melody on the wind's movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Swiftness

entries: Certain earth elementals manifest as specific types of material, be they boulders, sand, or crystals.
bot.name: Elemental, Earth

entries: 15 feet. The mist stalker is surrounded by mist. Creatures in the aura are {@condition concealed}. If wind disperses the aura, it returns automatically at the start of the mist stalker's turn. This cloud is suppressed in water.
top.name: Mist Cloud

entries: The mist stalker ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from mist and fog.
top.name: Mist Vision

entries: {@damage 1d8+4} bludgeoning, DC 21
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The mist stalker makes its mist cloud congeal, causing the aura to be {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} until the start of the mist stalker's next turn.

In addition, the mist stalker can make the mist even thicker around a single Medium or smaller creature within the cloud. The creature must succeed at a DC 20 Reflex save or become {@condition immobilized} until it {@action Escape||Escapes} or it is no longer in the mist cloud's emanation.
bot.name: Solidify Mist

entries: A living creature slain by a mohrg that had a lower level than the mohrg rises as a mohrg spawn after {@dice 1d4} rounds, on its turn. This mohrg spawn is under the command of the mohrg that created it. If the creator of the mohrg spawn is destroyed, the mohrg spawn is destroyed as well, immediately collapsing into a pile of decayed flesh and bones.
mid.name: Mohrg Spawn

entries: A living creature hit by a mohrg's tongue {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 26 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each attempt.
bot.name: Paralysis

attacks.name: holy mace
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+15} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} force and {@damage 1d6} good plus solid blow

entries: 20 feet. Allies in the aura gain a +2 status bonus to saving throws against {@trait death} effects and effects that target or manipulate their souls.
mid.name: Spiritual Warden

entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a holy property rune while a monadic deva wields it.
bot.name: Holy Armaments

entries: The monadic deva speaks a word to cause a creature's soul to recoil at its sins or an undead creature to recoil at its lack of a soul. One non-good living or undead target within 40 feet takes {@damage 5d10} good damage and must attempt a DC 32 Fortitude save.
Regardless of the outcome, the target is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

entries.Success: The target takes half damage and is {@condition stunned 1}.
entries.Failure: The target takes full damage and is {@condition stunned 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The target takes double damage and is {@condition stunned 4}.

bot.name: Rebuke Soul

entries: When a monadic deva hits a target for the second time during its turn with its mace, it deals an additional {@damage 2d12} force damage as its weapon shimmers with ripples of power.
bot.name: Solid Blow

entries: 50 feet. The moonflower releases a pulse of bright light. Each non-moonflower creature in the emanation must attempt a DC 23 Fortitude save. The moonflower can't use Light Pulse again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Light Pulse

bot.trigger: The moonflower has swallowed a creature
entries: The swallowed creature is wrapped in a tight cocoon and extruded from the moonflower's body into an adjacent square. The creature continues to be Swallowed Whole. It can't use {@skill Acrobatics} to {@action Escape} a pod, but other creatures can attempt to Rupture the pod. The cocooned creature takes half damage from any damage dealt to the cocoon. Once the cocoon is Ruptured, it deflates and decays.
bot.name: Pod Prison

entries: Should a Small or larger creature die within a pod prison, the pod transforms into an adult moonflower with full Hit Points after {@dice 1d4} hours of growth. The newly formed moonflower has its own consciousness, but some aspect of its trunk or blossoms resembles the creature that died within. The dead creature's equipment remains inside the new moonflower and can be retrieved if the moonflower is slain.
bot.name: Pod Spawn

entries: Large, {@damage 2d10+10} bludgeoning and {@damage 2d6} acid, Rupture 21.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The morlock tinkers with an adjacent construct or mechanical hazard. They attempt a {@skill Crafting} check against the construct's or hazard's Fortitude DC. The morlock can't succeed if the target's level is more than double the morlock's.

entries.Critical Success: The target gains {@dice 4d6} HP and a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls for 1 minute.
entries.Success: The target gains {@dice 2d6} HP.
entries.Critical Failure: The morlock injures itself, taking {@dice 2d6} damage (typically bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, but potentially a different type at the GM's discretion).

bot.name: Instinctual Tinker

entries: The morlock {@action Stride||Strides} up to twice its Speed, during which it attempts a {@action High Jump} or a {@action Long Jump}. At any point during its movement, the morlock can make a melee {@action Strike} against an enemy in its reach. The morlock then can't use {@action Leap} Attack for 1 round.
bot.name: Leap Attack

entries: A morlock's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A morlock can share the same space as another morlock, but no more than two morlocks can occupy the same space. When morlocks share the same space, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls.
bot.name: Swarming Stance

entries: 20 feet. Allies in the movanic deva's aura gain a +1 status bonus to all saving throws, resistance 10 to positive and negative damage, and are unharmed by the effects of a plane's {@trait positive} and {@trait negative} traits. Animals in the aura of 12th level or lower don't attack the movanic deva or the deva's allies unless they are {@condition controlled} or otherwise forced to attack.
mid.name: Aura of Vitality

entries: The movanic deva attempts to unravel unwelcome magic effects on allies within its aura of vitality to protect them from malevolent forces. The movanic deva attempts a counteract check against as many spell effects affecting allies in the area as it wishes with a +19 counteract modifier and a counteract level of 4, rolling once for the selected effects.
bot.name: Dispelling Field

entries: When a movanic deva wields a weapon, that weapon gains the effect of a flaming rune.
bot.name: Flaming Armaments

entries: 10 feet. The ground in the area is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for all non-mudwretch creatures.
top.name: Muddy Field

entries: If a mudwretch takes any damage from horrid wilting or a similar effect, takes 10 or more fire damage from a single effect, or spends more than 24 hours outside of a source of sufficient hydration (such as a swamp, river, well, or recent rainfall), it becomes dehydrated. While dehydrated, the mudwretch can't Spew Mud, is {@condition sickened 2}, and is {@condition slowed 1} until it either fully immerses in water, spends 1 minute in the rain, or rehydrates in another way (such as via Gory Hydration).
mid.name: Susceptible to Desiccation

entries: {@damage 1d8+2} bludgeoning, DC 18
bot.name: Constrict

bot.trigger: The mudwretch deals Constrict damage to a living creature that has blood
bot.requirements: The mudwretch is dehydrated
entries: The mudwretch squeezes harder, dealing {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} to the target. The mudwretch absorbs this blood, removing any penalties it had as a result of being dehydrated.
bot.name: Gory Hydration

entries: Until it next acts, the mudwretch appears to be an ordinary puddle of mud.
It has an automatic result of 20 on {@skill Deception} checks to pass as a mud puddle and can make a fist {@action Strike} against a creature that walks onto the mud puddle as a reaction.
bot.name: Mud Puddle

entries: The mudwretch spews a 20-foot line of pressurized mud that deals {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage (DC 18 basic Reflex save). On a critical failure, a creature also takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. The mudwretch can't Spew Mud again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Spew Mud

entries: 30 feet. When a non-demon ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 23 Fortitude save. If it fails, it becomes {@condition drained 1}.
mid.name: Death-Stealing Gaze

entries: A nabasu denied food suffers painful backlash as their demonic nature feeds on their own corrupted spirituality. If a nabasu's Consume Death is disrupted (such as by a fighter using Disruptive Stance) or a creature resists the effect with a critical success, the nabasu takes {@damage 4d6} mental damage.
mid.name: Starvation Vulnerability

entries: The nabasu focuses their death-stealing gaze upon a single target they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against death-stealing gaze.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and the nabasu suffers starvation vulnerability.
entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is affected by deathstealing gaze and becomes {@condition drained 1}. If the creature was already {@condition drained 1} by the death-stealing gaze before attempting the save, a failed save increases the value of the {@condition drained} condition by 1, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}. The nabasu gains 10 temporary Hit Points, and the {@condition drained} creature is temporarily immune until the start of the nabasu's next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature increases the amount of drain by 2.

bot.name: Consume Death

entries: A creature that dies while suffering drain from a nabasu's death-stealing gaze rises as a ghoul (Pathfinder Bestiary 168) the next midnight.
bot.name: Stolen Death

entries: A nalfeshnee's greed is such that losing possessions causes them harm. If an item is stolen from a nalfeshnee, the demon takes {@damage 3d6+10} mental damage.
mid.name: Forfeiture Aversion

mid.trigger: A creature critically fails a weapon {@action Strike} against the nalfeshnee
entries: The nalfeshnee attempts to {@action Disarm} the weapon used in the triggering {@action Strike} at a –2 circumstance penalty. On a success, the nalfeshnee steals the weapon.
mid.name: Greedy Grab

entries: The nalfeshnee steals all unattended items glowing with its Light of Avarice into an extradimensional space. The demon can {@action Interact} to regurgitate any number of these items into their hand or onto the ground. If the demon dies, is affected by a {@trait teleportation} effect, or consumes an extradimensional space (such as a bag of holding), they vomit up all the items.
bot.name: Claim Wealth

entries: Beams of unholy light shoot from the nalfeshnee toward four items within 60 feet. If someone is holding or wearing a targeted item, they can keep it from being affected with a successful DC 34 Reflex save. For 1 minute, the affected items glow in nauseating colors. Any non-demon is {@condition sickened 2} and {@condition slowed 1} as long as it holds, wears, or touches a glowing item. Recovering from the sickness requires a successful DC 29 Will save instead of a Fortitude save. Ending the sickness this way ends the {@condition slowed} condition and makes the creature temporarily immune to Light of Avarice for 24 hours. If the creature removes or drops the item, both conditions end immediately but the creature doesn't become immune to Light of Avarice.
bot.name: Light of Avarice

entries: The necrophidius sways, its serpentine form undulating and clattering in a hypnotic rhythm. Each creature that witnesses the dance must attempt a DC 18 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is unnerved by the swaying and becomes {@condition flat-footed} until the end of the necrophidius's next turn.
entries.Failure: The creature is distracted by the swaying, becoming {@condition stunned 1}. After it recovers, it is {@condition flat-footed} until the end of the necrophidius's next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but {@condition stunned 3}.

bot.name: Dance of Death

entries: A living creature bitten by a necrophidius must succeed at a DC 20 Fortitude save or become {@condition paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 for each save attempted. A creature that succeeds at this save is temporarily immune to necrophidic paralysis for 24 hours.
bot.name: Necrophidic Paralysis

entries: The neothelid uses its mind as a precise sense at the listed range to notice all non-mindless creatures.
top.name: Thoughtsense

mid.trigger: A creature the neothelid is aware of uses a {@trait teleportation} effect
entries: The neothelid creates an extradimensional wormhole at the triggering creature's initial location that persists for up to 1 minute.
If the neothelid moves into the wormhole's space, the neothelid teleports to the same destination as the triggering creature.
mid.name: Dimensional Wormhole

entries: The neothelid breathes a spray of acid that deals {@damage 16d6} acid damage in a 60-foot cone (DC 38 basic Reflex save). The neothelid can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

bot.trigger: A creature fails a Will save against a spell or effect created by the neothelid
entries: The neothelid casts a {@spell suggestion} spell it has available on the creature that failed its Will save.
bot.name: Instant Suggestion

entries: The neothelid's four tongues lash out in a frenzy at several targets. It makes up to four rasping tongue {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the neothelid's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the neothelid makes all of its attacks.
bot.name: Lashing Tongues

entries: Large, {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d12} acid, Rupture 27.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: When underwater, the nereid's body is {@condition invisible}. The nereid can dismiss or resume this transparency as an action that has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Watery Transparency

entries: The nereid touches a creature and causes water from its own body to flow into the creature's lungs. If the creature cannot breathe water, it must attempt a DC 29 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Drowning Touch for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature becomes {@condition sickened 3} as it chokes on the water.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature chokes on the water and runs out of air. It falls {@condition unconscious} and starts drowning (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 478). If the creature is above water, it recovers from drowning as soon as it succeeds at a saving throw against suffocation.

bot.name: Drowning Touch

entries: The nereid divests themself of part of their connection to the First World and imbues this essence into a flowing shawl that enables them to function on land. The nereid can {@action Dismiss} this effect as long as they are touching the shawl. As long as the shawl exists, the nereid gains the {@trait amphibious} trait. A nonnereid who carries the shawl also gains the {@trait amphibious} trait. If a nereid's shawl is destroyed rather than Dismissed, the nereid can't Manifest a Shawl for 24 hours.
bot.name: Manifest Shawl

entries: The nixie can use {@skill Diplomacy} to {@action Make an Impression} on and make very simple Requests of aquatic or amphibious animals.
top.name: Wild Empathy

entries: The nixie can duplicate any 1st-level spell or produce any effect with a power level in line with a 1st-level spell, but only in response to the request or desire of a non-fey creature. The creature whose desire is granted can never again benefit from that particular nixie's Grant Desire ability.
bot.name: Grant Desire

attacks.name: norn shears
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d6+15} slashing plus {@damage 5d6} negative and sever fate

entries: A norn automatically rolls a 20 when she rolls initiative.
top.name: Sense Fate

entries: This functions as the {@ability coven} ability, except only norns can join a triumvirate, and it functions only as long as exactly three norns are part of the triumvirate. A triumvirate grants the following spells: {@spell alter reality} (once per day), {@spell cataclysm}, {@spell discern location}, {@spell foresight}, and {@spell revival}.
top.name: Triumvirate

entries: When a creature is subject to a {@trait fortune} effect from a norn and a {@trait misfortune} effect from any source other than a norn (or vice versa), the norn's effect automatically counteracts the other effect and then takes place normally, rather than the two effects canceling each other out. If both the {@trait fortune} and {@trait misfortune} effect are from a norn, then the two cancel each other out as normal. At the GM's discretion, powerful entities related to fate or luck, like Desna, Magdh, or Pharasma, count as a norn for the purpose of this ability.
bot.name: Fated

entries: When a norn deals negative damage with a {@action Strike}, she regains 10 Hit Points. The target must succeed at a DC 39 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1} ({@condition drained 2} on a critical failure). Further negative damage dealt by the norn increases the {@condition drained} condition value by 1 on a failed save (or by 2 on a critical failure), to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Sever Fate

bot.trigger: A creature within 120 feet attempts a saving throw
entries: The creature rolls the saving throw twice, and then the norn decides which result applies. If the norn chooses the lower roll, this is a {@trait misfortune} effect; if she chooses the higher roll, it's a {@trait fortune} effect; if they're the same, she decides which trait to apply.
bot.name: Shift Fate

entries: The norn produces a golden thread linked to the fate of a creature within 100 feet of her, then snips it short with her shears. The target takes 100 negative damage (DC 42 basic Fortitude save). If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points from this damage, the thread is completely severed and the creature dies immediately. A creature slain by Snip Thread can't be restored to life except by miracle, wish, or similarly powerful magic; or by divine intervention. Regardless of the outcome of their saving throw, a creature targeted by Snip Thread then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. The norn can't use Snip Thread again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Snip Thread

entries: 30 feet, DC 25
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: Unpolluted fresh water burns a nuckelavee like acid, dealing {@dice 1d6} damage to it and causing it to be {@condition sickened 2}. A nuckelavee can't heal from damage when it's in an area that isn't polluted (subject to GM discretion).
mid.name: Purity Vulnerability

entries: The nuckelavee breathes a 30-foot cone of foulness, dealing {@damage 8d6} negative damage (DC 28 basic Fortitude save) to living creatures in the area.
A creature that fails also takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
The nuckelavee can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon
Mortasheen
bot.note: The target can't recover from the {@condition fatigued} condition caused by mortasheen until the disease is cured. Mortasheen gains the {@trait virulent} trait against animals and plants

entries: Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 28
bot.name: Trample

mid.trigger: A Medium creature within the nuglub's reach leaves a square during its move action
entries: The nuglub lashes out at the triggering creature's knees and tries to knock them {@condition prone}. The nuglub makes an {@skill Acrobatics} check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands {@condition prone}.
mid.name: Kneecapper

entries: A nuglub's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} targets, or {@dice 1d10} if the target is {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+13} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} acid, {@damage 1d6} chaotic, and Grab

attacks.name: tentacle mouth
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+13} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} acid, {@damage 1d6} chaotic, and Grab

mid.trigger: The nyogoth takes piercing or slashing damage
entries: The nyogoth sprays its acidic blood on adjacent creatures, dealing {@damage 6d6} acid damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Caustic Blood

bot.requirements: The nyogoth has {@condition grabbed} a creature
entries: The nyogoth slavers and chews at the {@condition grabbed} creature, dealing {@damage 2d6+7} slashing and {@damage 1d6} acid damage (DC 29 basic Fortitude save).
bot.name: Feeding Frenzy

entries: The nyogoth untangles its tentacles and prolapses its many mouths, turning itself inside out in a truly nauseating display.
Creatures in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a DC 29 Will save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Nauseating Displays for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 3} and {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 5} and {@condition sickened 2}.

bot.name: Nauseating Display

entries: The ogre spider has imprecise {@ability tremorsense} to detect the vibrations of creatures touching its web.
top.name: Web Sense

entries: An ogre spider can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Large creature. While {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}, it can move at its full speed.
bot.name: Eerie Flexibility

entries: A creature hit by the ogre spider's web attack is {@condition immobilized} and stuck to the nearest surface until it {@action Escape||Escapes} (DC 22).
bot.name: Web Trap

entries: 60 feet. Any creature that begins its turn in the aura is {@condition doomed 1} for as long as it remains in the aura and for 1 hour thereafter.
mid.name: Aura of Doom

entries: The daemon expels a shrieking black cloud of smoke from its mouth in a 120-foot line or a 60-foot cone
(or both a line and a cone in the same direction if it spends 3 actions). Living creatures in the area take {@damage 24d6} negative damage (DC 45 basic Reflex save)
The olethrodaemon can't use Apocalypse Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Apocalypse Breath

bot.requirements: The olethrodaemon has a soul gem
entries: The olethrodaemon crushes the soul gem in one hand and regains the use of Apocalypse Breath or any one of its innate spells.
bot.name: Soul Crush

entries: Huge, {@damage 4d10+10} bludgeoning and {@condition drained 2}, Rupture 43. An olethrodaemon has numerous stomachs connected by labyrinthine digestive organs. Swallowed creatures cannot {@action Escape}, but can attempt to cut their way out with a {@dice 1d6} roll. On a roll of 1–3, the creature cuts into yet another stomach.
On a roll of 4–6, the creature manages to cut its way out of the olethrodaemon.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: The onidoshi takes on the appearance of an {@creature ogre}. This doesn't change their Speed or {@action Strike} attack and damage.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The ooze mephit spits toxic slime in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} poison damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The ooze mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

abilities: fast healing 2 (while touching mud or slime)

entries: An orca can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range, but only underwater.
top.name: Aquatic Echolocation

entries: An orca can hold its breath for 2 hours.
top.name: Deep Breath

entries: 30 feet. An orca can travel no further than 5 feet onto land as part of an Aquatic Ambush. After it does so, it is {@condition prone} until it Crawls to return to the water.
bot.name: Aquatic Ambush

entries: The orca Swims up to its swim Speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 25 feet in the air, making a {@action Strike} against a creature at any point during the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water's surface). After the {@action Strike}, the orca splashes back down into the water.
bot.name: Breach

entries: The guard makes a melee {@action Strike}. This counts as two attacks when calculating the guard's multiple attack penalty. If this {@action Strike} hits, the guard deals an extra die of weapon damage.
bot.name: Power Attack

entries: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the {@condition doomed}, {@condition dying}, and {@condition wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.
top.name: Painsight

entries: The ostiarius always knows the direction and distance to the closest portal between the Shadow.
top.name: Sense Portal

entries: This sense functions only on these two planes.
top.name: Plane and the Material Plane.

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it hears the wounds on the ostiarius's body whisper obscene truths. The creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition sickened 1}.
mid.name: Whispering Wounds

entries: The ostiarius inspires their willing allies and themself by whispering words of courage from their wounds.
The ostiarius and their allies in a 50-foot emanation gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against {@trait fear} effects.

The ostiarius can Sustain Compel Courage. Non-velstracs who accept this compelled courage find bleeding wounds opening on their own bodies to whisper in thanks. They take 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and can't attempt a flat check to end this damage as long as they're compelled.
bot.name: Compel Courage

entries: The ostiarius stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against whispering wounds. In addition, if the creature was already {@condition sickened} and fails its save, the creature is {@condition fascinated} by the ostiarius and can't use {@condition hostile} actions. This fascination lasts for 1 round or until the ostiarius takes any {@condition hostile} action against the creature or the creature's allies. Whether the creature succeeds at or fails the save, it is temporarily immune for 1 hour.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

attacks.name: stinger
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+11} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and osyluth venom

entries: The osyluth can cast innate invisibility using only 1 action.
bot.name: Quick Invisibility

entries: An osyluth deals an extra {@dice 2d6} damage whenever they {@action Strike} an {@condition enfeebled}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition prone} creature.
bot.name: Sadistic Strike

entries: The osyluth telepathically questions a creature affected by zone of truth. After 1 round, if the creature intentionally refuses to answer the question, it takes {@damage 2d6} mental damage.
bot.name: Stygian Inquisitor

entries: The osyluth sweeps their tail in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed at a DC 26 Reflex save or be knocked {@condition prone}.
bot.name: Tail Sweep

entries: The pachycephalosaurus {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed. If it ends its movement within melee reach of a target, it can make a skull {@action Strike} against that target. If the pachycephalosaurus critically hits with this {@action Strike}, the creature hit is {@condition stunned 1}.
bot.name: Clobbering Charge

bot.trigger: The pachycephalosaurus damages a Medium or smaller foe with its skull {@action Strike}
entries: The pachycephalosaurus digs in and flings its head up, shoving its foe away. It attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against the target's Fortitude DC.

entries.Critical Success: The pachycephalosaurus pushes the opponent up to 10 feet away from itself and knocks the target {@condition prone}.
entries.Success: The pachycephalosaurus pushes the opponent back 5 feet.
entries.Failure: The pachycephalosaurus fails to push the opponent.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the failed attempt leaves the pachycephalosaurus {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round.

bot.name: Sudden Shove

entries: If the peluda takes 30 or more slashing damage from a critical hit, the attacker severs the peluda's tail. The peluda takes {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and can't make tail attacks until their tail grows back (in about 1 week).
mid.name: Vulnerable Tail

mid.trigger: A creature within 10 feet attempts a melee {@action Strike} against the peluda
entries: The peluda shifts their position and makes a quill {@action Strike} against the attacking creature. This {@action Strike} doesn't count toward the peluda's multiple attack penalty, and the peluda's multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this {@action Strike}.
mid.name: Quill Thrust

entries: The peluda breathes a torrent of flames that deals {@damage 7d10} fire damage in a 60-foot line (DC 29 basic Reflex save). They can't use their Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The peluda bristles their quills and shakes, sending dozens of spear-like barbs in every direction. All creatures within 30 feet take {@damage 11d6} piercing damage (DC 29 basic Reflex save) and are exposed to peluda venom if they take any damage. The peluda can't use Quill Barrage again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Quill Barrage

entries: The peryton rips out the heart of an adjacent corpse with their jaws.

The creature must have died in the last minute. As the peryton rips the heart free and swallows it whole, they regain {@dice 2d6} HP, and any non-peryton that witnesses this event must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened 1} (or {@condition frightened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Heart Ripper

bot.requirements: The target must be casting a shadow
entries: The peryton Flies, going no higher than 20 feet over the target creature. The target creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or the peryton's shadow changes to match that cast by the target creature. With their shadow so transformed, the peryton gains a +2 status bonus to attack and damage rolls against that creature. In addition, each time the peryton successfully {@action Strike||Strikes} that creature, the creature must succeed at a DC 21 Will save or become {@condition frightened 1}, or increase its {@condition frightened} condition by 1 if it's already {@condition frightened}. This is an {@trait emotion} and {@trait fear} effect. The shadow remains transformed for 1 hour or until the peryton Mimics a Shadow again, whichever comes first.
bot.name: Mimic Shadow

creature.name: Petitioner (Abaddon)
creature.description: The hunted appear as Medium sized versions of themselves from their prior lives, and they exist to be pursued and consumed by daemons.

creature.name: Petitioner (Abyss)
creature.description: The larvae appear as maggot-like grubs with the face the petitioners had in life.

creature.name: Petitioner (Axis)
creature.description: The unmade appear as parchment-skinned humanoids covered in lines of close black script.

creature.name: Petitioner (Astral Plane)
creature.description: The untethered appear as astrally projected versions of their mortal forms, yet they lack a silver cord.

notes: any one spoken in life (such as {@language common})

creature.name: Petitioner (Boneyard)
creature.description: The dead appear as animated skeletons of the type of creature they were when they were alive.

creature.name: Petitioner (Dead Vault)
creature.description: The caged are sent to Rovagug's prison plane, the Dead Vault; they appear as chained versions of their mortal bodies, save that their faces are hideous insectile visages.

entries: bite
bot.name: Rend

entries: All petitioners are formed from and personify the nature of the plane on which they manifest, and their statistics are adjusted as summarized below. They also gain any trait associated with creatures from their plane.

items: {@b {@creature Petitioner (Abaddon)|B2|Abaddon} (the Hunted)} The hunted appear as Medium sized versions of themselves from their prior lives, and they exist to be pursued and consumed by daemons; {@b Alignment} {@trait NE}; {@b Language} {@language Daemonic}; {@b Additional Ability} {@ability fast healing} 5; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b {@creature Petitioner (Abyss)|B2|Abyss} (the Larvae)} The larvae appear as maggot-like grubs with the face the petitioners had in life; {@b Alignment} {@trait CE}; {@b Language} {@language Abyssal}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to disease and poison; {@b Melee} jaws {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} piercing

{@b {@creature Petitioner (Astral Plane)|B2|Astral Plane} (the Untethered)} The untethered appear as astrally projected versions of their mortal forms, yet they lack a silver cord; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} any one spoken in life (such as {@language Common}); {@b Additional Ability} fly Speed 20 feet; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b {@creature Petitioner (Axis)|B2|Axis} (the Unmade)} The unmade appear as parchment-skinned humanoids covered in lines of close black script; {@b Alignment} {@trait LN}; {@b Language} {@language Utopian}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to emotion and fear; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b {@creature Petitioner (Boneyard)|B2|Boneyard} (the Dead)} The dead appear as animated skeletons of the type of creature they were when they were alive; {@b Alignment} {@trait N}; {@b Language} {@language Requian}; {@b Additional Ability} resist piercing and slashing 3; {@b Melee} claw {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} slashing

{@b {@creature Petitioner (Dead Vault)|B2|Dead Vault} (the Caged)} The caged are sent to Rovagug's prison plane, the Dead Vault; they appear as chained versions of their mortal bodies, save that their faces are hideous insectile visages; {@b Alignment} {@trait CE}; {@b Language} {@language Abyssal}; {@b Additional Ability} Rend [one-action] bite; {@b Melee} bite {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} piercing

{@b Dimension of Dreams (the Dreamers)} The dreamers appear as their ideal appearance, age, and gender from their mortal bodies; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} {@language Aklo}; {@b Additional Ability} {@dice 1d20+1|+1} circumstance bonus on all saving throws; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Elysium (the Chosen)} The chosen appear as idealized versions of their mortal selves with glowing eyes; {@b Alignment} {@trait CG}; {@b Language} {@language Celestial}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to blindness and dazzled; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Ethereal Plane (the Terrorized)} The terrorized appear as sickly, haunted-looking versions of their mortal selves; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} any one spoken in life (such as {@language Common}); {@b Additional Ability} immune to bleed and death effects; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Heaven (the Elect)} The elect have golden halos and ghostly wings, but they otherwise appear as their mortal forms; {@b Alignment} {@trait LG}; {@b Language} {@language Celestial}; {@b Additional Ability} fly Speed 20 feet; {@b Melee} wing {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Hell (the Damned)} The damned look like terribly scarred or mutilated versions of their mortal selves; {@b Alignment} {@trait LE}; {@b Language} {@language Infernal}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to fire; {@b Melee} jaws {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} piercing

{@b Maelstrom (the Shapeless)} The shapeless appear as half-melted reflections of their former mortal selves; {@b Alignment} {@trait CN}; {@b Language} {@language Protean}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to critical hits and precision; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Material Plane (the Remnants)} The remnants are among the rarest of petitioners; they appear as plain, bland versions of the ancestry of their mortal lives; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} any one spoken in life (such as {@language Common}); {@b Additional Ability} ferocity; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Nirvana (the Cleansed)} The cleansed take on animal forms that match their personalities in life; {@b Alignment} {@trait NG}; {@b Language} {@language Celestial}; {@b Additional Ability} speed 35 feet; {@b Melee} claw {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} slashing

{@b Plane of Air (the Air Pneuma)} Air pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves composed of air; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} {@language Auran}; {@b Additional Ability} fly Speed 20 feet; {@b Melee} gust {@dice 1d20+7|+7} ({@trait air}), Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Plane of Earth (the Earth Pneuma)} Earth pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves built of earth or stone; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} {@language Terran}; {@b Additional Ability} burrow Speed 20 feet; {@b Melee} fist {@dice 1d20+7|+7} ({@trait earth}), Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Plane of Fire (the Fire Pneuma)} Fire pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves shaped from flame; {@b Alignment} {@trait any}; {@b Language} {@language Ignan}; {@b Additional Ability} immunity to fire; {@b Melee} cinder {@dice 1d20+7|+7} ({@trait fire}), Damage {@dice 1d8+2} fire

{@b Plane of Water (the Water Pneuma)} Water pneuma appear as versions of their mortal selves formed of flowing water; {@b Alignment} any; {@b Language} {@language Aquan}; {@b Additional Ability} {@ability amphibious}, swim Speed 20 feet; {@b Melee} current {@dice 1d20+7|+7} ({@trait water}), Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

{@b Positive Energy Plane (the Enlightened)} The enlightened appear as diaphanous, radiant versions of their mortal selves; {@b Alignment} any good; {@b Language} {@language Jyoti}; Additional Ability {@ability fast healing} 5; {@b Melee} glowing touch {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} positive

{@b Shadow Plane (the Mutilated)} The mutilated appear as they did in their mortal lives, yet are covered in wounds or partially adorned or wrapped in chains; {@b Alignment} {@trait any} evil; {@b Language} {@language Shadowtongue}; {@b Additional Ability} immune to bleed and fear; {@b Melee} chain {@dice 1d20+7|+7}, Damage {@dice 1d8+2} bludgeoning

bot.name: Planar Incarnation

mid.trigger: A creature within 30 feet attempts a saving throw against piscovenom
entries: The creature takes an additional {@damage 2d8} poison damage even if it succeeds at its save.
mid.name: Enhance Venom

entries: {@damage 2d10+6} bludgeoning, DC 30
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The piscodaemon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} against the same creature. If both hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d10} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and is exposed to piscovenom.
bot.name: Gory Rend

entries: 20 feet. Allies in the planetar's aura gain a +2 status bonus to AC against evil creatures and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls against evil creatures. The area in the aura is {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for evil creatures.
mid.name: Aura of Righteousness

entries: The planetar makes a greatsword {@action Strike} against a target it detects as evil. If the target is evil, the {@action Strike} deals three extra weapon damage dice and deals {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent good damage} to the target.
The planetar can convert all the physical damage from the attack into good damage.
bot.name: Blade of Justice

entries: The planetar can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a holy property rune while a planetar wields it.
bot.name: Holy Armaments

entries: The polar bear's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The polar bear gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has {@condition grabbed}.
bot.name: Mauler

attacks.name: glaive
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+17} slashing plus {@damage 2d6} evil and {@damage 4d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed}

attacks.name: hurled weapon
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+12} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and {@damage 4d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed}

entries: The purrodaemon causes a weapon that has steeped in their flesh (see Steep Weapon) to telekinetically launch from their flesh. The purrodaemon makes a hurled weapon {@action Strike} without using their hands.
bot.name: Hurl Weapon

bot.requirements: A steeped weapon that's no longer sheathed in the purrodaemon's body is within 120 feet of the daemon
entries: The steeped weapon swiftly flies through the air to resheath itself in the purrodaemon's body. If a creature is along this flight path, the purrodaemon can make a hurled weapon {@action Strike} against the target; if it hits, the weapon drops to the ground in a square adjacent to the creature.
bot.name: Recall Weapon

entries: The purrodaemon sheathes a weapon in their own flesh. This deals no damage to the purrodaemon, which can have up to 10 weapons sheathed in their body at a time. A steeped weapon must be one that deals piercing or slashing damage.

If a purrodaemon Interacts to crush a soul gem, one weapon of their choice sheathed in their flesh becomes enchanted with the daemon's fiendish power and becomes a +2 greater striking weapon that can be used in place of their glaive or hurled at targets (with a +2 item bonus to the hurled weapon's attack modifier and an extra d10 of damage). This magical quality fades 24 hours after it ceases being sheathed in the daemon's living body. A steeped weapon can be Disarmed.
bot.name: Steep Weapon

bot.trigger: The purrodaemon is hit with a weapon that deals piercing damage
bot.requirements: The purrodaemon has fewer than 10 weapons sheathed in their body
entries: The purrodaemon seizes the triggering weapon. The weapon's wielder must attempt a DC 40 Reflex save. On a failure, the weapon is disarmed and falls to an adjacent square. On a critical failure, the weapon is sheathed in the purrodaemon's body as though the daemon had used Steep Weapon. an ability. Cacodaemons (Pathfinder Bestiary 70) are the most common also be created by spells like bind soul. If a daemon crushes a soul gem.
bot.name: Twist the Blade

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+13} piercing plus quetz couatl venom and Grab

entries: {@damage 2d10+7} bludgeoning, DC 29
bot.name: Greater Constrict
Quetz Couatl Venom
bot.note: A quetz couatl's venom deals good damage rather than poison damage to fiends

entries: The quetz couatl spreads its multicolored wings and radiant plumage. Each enemy within 30 feet must attempt a DC 29 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Radiant Wings for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 minute.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but if the creature is evil, it is also {@condition stunned 3}.

bot.name: Radiant Wings

bot.requirements: The quetz couatl has a
entries: Medium or smaller creature {@condition grabbed} or {@condition restrained} in its jaws; The quetz couatl moves the creature into its coils, freeing its fangs to make attacks, then uses.
bot.name: Wrap in Coils

entries: Constrict against the creature. The quetz couatl can hold as many creatures in its coils as will fit in its space.
bot.name: Greater

entries: The quickling takes a –2 status penalty to saving throws against effects that cause the {@condition slowed} condition. If the quickling ever becomes {@condition slowed}, they lose their supernatural speed, can't Fade from View, and become {@condition sickened 1} for the duration of the slow. They also can't reduce this {@condition sickened} condition for the duration of the {@condition slowed} effect.
mid.name: Slow Susceptibility

mid.trigger: The quickling is targeted by a {@action Strike}
entries: The quickling darts aside, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, then {@action Stride||Strides} up to half their Speed after the {@action Strike} resolves.
mid.name: Can't Catch Me

entries: The quickling's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: The quickling's speed, combined with nearly instantaneous acceleration and deceleration, enables them to move in astonishing ways. As long as they have a firm surface to travel across, they can {@action Stride} their full movement vertically or horizontally. They can even run across unstable surfaces, such as water, in the same way, although dangerous surfaces (acid, lava, etc.) harm them as normal. They must end their movement on a horizontal surface capable of bearing their weight or else they fall.
bot.name: Supernatural Speed

entries: Tentacle only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

bot.requirements: The quoppopak's ventral tube is in water
entries: The quoppopak uses Tentacle Stab against a creature within reach; if either of these {@action Strike||Strikes} hits, the creature must attempt a DC 30 Reflex save.
