On a failed save, the quoppopak shoots water through its tentacles into the creature, dealing {@damage 2d6+5} bludgeoning damage and making the creature {@condition sickened 1} as its internal organs fill with water (double damage and {@condition sickened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Flooding Thrust

entries: The quoppopak makes two tentacle {@action Strike||Strikes} against the same creature. These {@action Strike||Strikes} deal piercing damage instead of bludgeoning, and the quoppopak can't Grab with them. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
bot.name: Tentacle Stab

entries: The quoppopak can stand and move on the surface of water or other liquids without falling through. It can go underwater if it wishes, but it must {@action Swim} to do so.
bot.name: Water Glide

entries: 60 feet. A creature that uses a teleportation ability within the aura's emanation or enters it via a teleportation ability must succeed a DC 38 Will save or become {@condition sickened 1} and have its destination changed to a point of the radiant warden's choosing within the emanation. On a successful save, the creature arrives as intended but is still {@condition sickened 1}.
mid.name: Gatekeeper Aura

entries: Until it acts, the radiant warden appears to be an orrery (or similar large mechanical contraption, such as a telescope). It has an automatic result of 53 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to convincingly pass as such a machine.
bot.name: Orrery

entries: The radiant warden releases a 50-foot cone of bright energy that deals {@damage 10d12} force damage (DC 38 basic Reflex save). The radiant warden can't use Radiant Blast for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Radiant Blast

entries: When a creature is hit by the radiant warden's hammer {@action Strike}, a flash of radiant energy attempts to anchor the creature in place. The creature must attempt a DC 38 Will save; on a failure, the creature can't use any {@trait teleportation} effects for 1 minute.
On a critical failure, the creature is also permanently {@condition blinded}.
bot.name: Radiant Blow

entries: A raven can use simple items as tools, such as poking a stick at an opening to tease out a piece of food.

They are also quite adept at stealing objects. A raven can't use {@skill Thievery} to {@action Palm an Object}, {@action Disable a Device}, or {@action Pick a Lock}, but it can use {@skill Thievery} to {@action Steal} light objects that it can carry in its beak or talons or to accomplish other relatively simple tasks.
top.name: Cunning

entries: There are few things as dangerously persistent in the natural world as an angry unkindness of ravens. A raven swarm can hound its prey through most barriers. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep an unkindness away. A raven swarm attempts a {@skill Thievery} check to bypass many of these simple obstructions, typically against DC 20.
bot.name: Enraged Cunning

entries: The ravens' angry pecking deals {@damage 1d8} piercing damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (DC 20 basic Reflex save). A creature that critically fails its save is {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d4} rounds as the ravens focus their attacks on the target's vulnerable face.
bot.name: Swarming Beaks

entries: Smoke doesn't impair an ancient red ravener's vision; it ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: 90 feet, DC 42
mid.name: Cowering Fear

entries: 10 feet, {@damage 4d6} fire damage (DC 41 basic Reflex save)
mid.name: Dragon Heat

entries: 200 HP. An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points, or 200 if the ravener is level 21 or higher. Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed. A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses {@damage 1d4} Hit Points each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a ravener husk.
mid.name: Soul Ward

entries: Jaws only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

mid.trigger: The ravener takes excess damage to their soul ward but still has at least 51 Hit Points in their soul ward;
entries: The ravener draws deeply into their soul ward, discorporating their body into soul energy in order to escape. They take 50 damage to their soul ward and their physical body vanishes, reappearing {@dice 1d4} hours later in a random location within 1 mile from the location where they used Discorporate.
mid.name: Discorporate

mid.trigger: A creature within 100 feet casts a fire spell, or a fire spell otherwise comes into effect from a source within 100 feet
entries: The ravener makes all the choices to determine the targets, destination, and other effects of the spell, as though they were the caster.
mid.name: Redirect Fire

trigger: A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies;
entries: The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a DC 44 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are {@condition drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.
entries.Failure: As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is {@condition drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10th-level effect such as {@spell miracle} or {@spell wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.

bot.name: Consume Soul

entries: The ravener attempts to take control of a magical fire or a fire spell within 100 feet. If it succeeds at a counteract check (counteract level 10, counteract modifier +34), the original caster loses control of the spell or magical fire, control is transferred to the ravener, and this action counts as the ravener having Sustained the Spell with the action (if applicable). The ravener can choose to end the spell instead of taking control, if they choose.
bot.name: Manipulate Flames

entries: The ravener breathes a blast of flame that deals {@damage 20d6} fire damage plus {@damage 4d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent negative damage} (DC 44 basic Reflex save). A creature that fails its save is also {@condition drained 1} (or {@condition drained 2} on a critical failure). If a creature is {@condition drained} by the ravener's Ravenous Breath Weapon, the ravener's soul ward gains 5 HP. The ravener can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Ravenous Breath Weapon

entries: The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their {@action Strike|Strikes}, the target must succeed on a Fortitude save or gain the {@condition drained 1} condition. If the target already has a {@condition drained} value of greater than 0, their {@condition drained} value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}. Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.
bot.name: Vicious Criticals

entries: 90 feet, DC 31
mid.name: Frightful Presence

mid.trigger: The ravener husk takes any amount of bludgeoning damage
entries: The ravener's brittle bones shatter, spraying bone shards everywhere. Every creature within a 10-foot emanation of the ravener husk takes {@damage 7d6} piercing damage (DC 31 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Boneshatter

entries: The ravener husk breathes a torrent of negative energy that deals {@damage 16d6} negative damage in a 40-foot cone (DC 34 basic Reflex save). They can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The ravener husk makes a jaws {@action Strike} against a deceased creature that has been dead no longer than 1 minute, was good aligned, and was at least level 15 in life. The ravener attempts a DC {@flatDC 5} flat check; if successful, they transform back into a ravener with 1 Hit Point in their soul ward.
bot.name: Ravenous Repast

entries: The blue-ringed octopus can change the color of its skin to {@action Hide} even if it doesn't have cover.
bot.name: Camouflage

entries: The reef octopus emits a cloud of dark-brown ink in a 10-foot emanation. This cloud has no effect outside of water. Creatures inside the cloud are {@condition hidden} and can't use their sense of smell. The cloud dissipates after 1 minute. The octopus can't use Ink Cloud again for {@dice 2d6} rounds.
bot.name: Ink Cloud

entries: The reef octopus moves up to 80 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions.
bot.name: Jet

entries: The reef octopus makes up to four arm {@action Strike||Strikes} with different arms, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the octopus's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all of its attacks.
bot.name: Writhing Arms

notes: any one spoken in life by their murderer (typically {@language common})

entries: A revenant knows the direction of their murderer (as long as both are on the same plane), but not the distance.
top.name: Sense Murderer

entries: If a revenant sees their own reflection or any object that was important to them in life, they must attempt a DC 25 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The revenant is unaffected and can no longer be affected by that reflection or object in this way.
entries.Success: The revenant is distracted by self-loathing and becomes {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The revenant becomes {@condition fascinated} by the source that triggered their self-loathing and does everything they can to destroy it until the end of the revenant's next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: The revenant becomes {@condition immobilized} as long as the source of their self-loathing is apparent, until they're attacked, or until they see their murderer.

mid.name: Self-Loathing

entries: If the revenant's murderer dies, the revenant is immediately destroyed. A revenant that can't sense their murderer must attempt a DC {@flatDC 11} flat check once every 24 hours to avoid becoming {@condition immobilized} and {@condition prone}; they immediately rise again once they can sense their murderer. A murderer who becomes undead does not trigger the revenant's destruction until the murderer is finally destroyed. The revenant gains a +2 status bonus to checks and DCs against their murderer.
mid.name: Undying Vendetta

entries: The revenant wails horribly. Each creature within a 60-foot burst must attempt a DC 23 Will save. Regardless of the outcome of their saving throw, affected creatures are then immune to Baleful Shriek for 1 hour. The revenant's murderer never improves their degree of success due to this ability's {@trait incapacitation} trait. The revenant can't use Baleful Shriek again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 3} and {@condition paralyzed} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

bot.name: Baleful Shriek

entries: {@damage 2d6+5} bludgeoning, DC 24
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The rhinoceros {@action Stride||Strides} twice, then makes a horn {@action Strike}. As long as the rhinoceros moved at least 20 feet, the {@action Strike}'s damage increases to {@dice 3d8+6}. A Medium or smaller creature struck by this attack must succeed at a DC 21 Reflex save or be automatically Shoved back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone} by the force of the blow.
bot.name: Rhinoceros Charge

entries: Medium or smaller, foot, DC 18
bot.name: Trample

entries: A rusalka is {@condition concealed} while underwater.
mid.name: Blurred Form

entries: The rusalka cries out a compelling invitation. Each non-fey creature within a 300-foot emanation must attempt a DC 27 Will save. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the rusalka uses Beckoning Call again on subsequent rounds, the duration extends by 1 round for all affected creatures. Once a creature succeeds at any save against Beckoning Call, that creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated} and must spend each of its actions to move closer to the rusalka, avoiding obvious dangers. If a beckoned creature is adjacent to the rusalka, it stays still and doesn't act. If attacked by the rusalka, the creature is freed from captivation at the end of the rusalka's turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but if attacked by the rusalka, the creature can attempt a new save only at the start of its next turn, rather than being freed at the end of the rusalka's turn.

bot.name: Beckoning Call

entries: {@damage 2d8+10} bludgeoning, DC 32
bot.name: Constrict

entries: A rusalka can have up to eight creatures {@condition grabbed} within their tresses at a time.
bot.name: Entangling Tresses

entries: The rusalka attempts an {@skill Athletics} check against each {@condition grabbed} creature's Fortitude DC. The rusalka moves each creature they succeed against up to 10 feet and each creature they critically succeed against up to 20 feet. This movement must all be within reach of its tresses.
bot.name: Flowing Hair

entries: The rusalka touches a creature within 5 feet using their hand, stirring up memories of regret and shame. The target must attempt a DC 35 Will save.

entries.Success: The target is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 1} and {@condition stunned 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 1} and {@condition stunned 1}, and it must use its first action on its next turn to {@action Strike} itself, automatically hitting.

bot.name: Shameful Touch

attacks.name: barbed chain
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+9} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and {@damage 2d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed}

entries: A velstrac automatically knows whether a creature it sees has any of the {@condition doomed}, {@condition dying}, and {@condition wounded} conditions, as well as the value of those conditions.
top.name: Painsight

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it sees a vision of the sacristan groveling in pitiable servitude. The creature must succeed at a DC 27 Will save or become {@condition stunned 1}.
mid.name: Staggering Servitude

entries: The sacristan stares at a creature they can see within 30 feet. The creature must immediately attempt a Will save against staggering servitude. In addition, if the creature was already {@condition stunned}, on a failed save its revulsion toward the sacristan's presence causes it to be {@condition stupefied 2} for 1 minute. After attempting this save, the creature is then temporarily immune until the start of the sacristan's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

entries: The sacristan opens their mouth to unloose the wailing howls and mind-twisting darkness of the Shadow Plane. This creates a 30-foot emanation of darkness and wailing sounds around the sacristan. Creatures with {@ability darkvision} can't see through this darkness. The sacristan can Sustain Shadow Scream for up to 1 minute. Non-velstrac creatures in the area when the ability is used, as well as those who enter or start their turn in the area, must attempt a DC 28 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition confused} and {@condition deafened} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes 20 mental damage, and is {@condition confused} and {@condition deafened} for 1 round.

bot.name: Shadow Scream

entries: When the sand sentry takes fire or lightning damage, its outer layer of sand fuses into sheets of hardened glass for 1 minute. This increases the sand sentry's AC to 26 and grants it resistance 5 to acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, piercing, and slashing damage. A sand sentry can't use earth glide while glass armor is active.
mid.name: Glass Armor

entries: A living boulder can {@action Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock.
When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.
bot.name: Earth Glide

entries: When the sand sentry critically hits with a fist {@action Strike}, the target is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.
bot.name: Blinding Sand

entries: Hoof only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The Sandpoint Devil breathes a 30-foot cone of flame that deals {@damage 6d10} fire damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a DC 26 Reflex save. The.
bot.name: Accursed Breath

entries: Devil can't use Accursed Breath for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition sickened 2} by the agonizing pain of its burns.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes full damage and is cursed. The victim's flesh appears charred and burned, and the pain of being burned alive never fully vanishes. The cursed creature takes a –2 status penalty to all checks from the constant pain. Healing doesn't alter the appearance of the burns or lessen the penalty, but removing the curse does.

bot.name: Sandpoint

entries: The Sandpoint Devil unleashes a bloodcurdling howl that can be heard for miles. Each creature within a 100-foot emanation must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or become {@condition frightened 2} ({@condition frightened 3} and {@condition fleeing} as long as it remains {@condition frightened} on a critical failure). Creatures that attempt this Will save are then immune to Devil's Howl for 24 hours.
bot.name: Devil's Howl

entries: Medium or smaller, hoof, DC 23
bot.name: Trample

entries: The sard treats the plane it is located on as its home plane.
top.name: Planar Acclimation

entries: When the sard dies, its body explodes in a 30-foot emanation.
All creatures in the area take {@damage 10d6} electricity damage and {@damage 10d6} piercing damage (DC 43 basic Reflex save). Any creature that takes piercing damage is also exposed to sard venom.
mid.name: Splintering Death

bot.trigger: The sard is about to damage a creature that has electricity resistance
entries: An instant before the target takes the electricity damage from the triggering event, the sard's electrical sparks glow red. The target must succeed at a DC 41 Will save or lose any electricity resistance it has until this curse is lifted.
bot.name: Lightning-Struck Curse

stages.entry: {@damage 2d6} electricity damage, {@damage 2d6} poison damage, and {@condition clumsy 2}
{@damage 3d6} electricity damage, {@damage 3d6} poison damage, {@condition clumsy 2}, and {@condition slowed 1}
{@damage 4d6} electricity damage, {@damage 4d6} poison damage, {@condition clumsy 2}, and {@condition slowed 2}

entries: The sard makes up to four thorn {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. The sard's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.
bot.name: Thorn Volley

entries: Huge or smaller, root, DC 39
bot.name: Trample

attacks.name: tentacle arm
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+9} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} evil and sarglagon venom

entries: 10 feet. A creature that enters the heavy aura must attempt a DC 23 Will save. It is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition encumbered} while it remains in the area. If the creature is already {@condition encumbered}, it is {@condition immobilized} while it remains within the aura.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the effect persists for 3 rounds after leaving the aura.

mid.name: Heavy Aura

mid.trigger: A creature or object within the sarglagon's reach is targeted by an attack
entries: The sarglagon interposes themself, giving the creature or object standard cover against the attack (+2 circumstance bonus to AC), or greater cover (+4 circumstance bonus to AC) if the sarglagon was already granting it lesser cover.
mid.name: Stygian Guardian

entries: The sarglagon conjures murky water to fill the lungs of a creature that can't breathe water within 30 feet. The target must attempt a DC 26 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The target coughs up water and is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The target is holding its breath (Core Rulebook 478). The only action it can take is to attempt a Fortitude save against Drown to expel the water, which is a single action.
entries.Critical Failure: The target falls {@condition unconscious} and begins suffocating. If the target succeeds at its Fortitude save while suffocating, it coughs up the water and can breathe again.

bot.name: Drown

entries: 40 feet. The scarecrow's eyes flicker with an unnerving glow. A creature can't reduce its {@condition frightened} condition below 1 as long as it is in the aura's emanation.
When a creature enters or starts its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 18 Will save. Birds and other avian creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to this save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and is {@condition fascinated} by the scarecrow until the end of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but {@condition frightened 3}.

mid.name: Scarecrow's Leer

entries: The scarecrow's head bursts into ghostly, heatless flame that sheds bright light in a 20-foot emanation (and dim light to the next 20 feet). If the scarecrow uses this ability on the first round of combat, any creature that has not acted yet is startled and becomes {@condition flat-footed} against the scarecrow for 1 round. It can suppress the light by using this action again.
bot.name: Baleful Glow

entries: The scarecrow's strikes deal an additional {@damage 1d6} mental damage to {@condition frightened} creatures.
bot.name: Clawing Fear

entries: Until it acts, the scarecrow resembles an ordinary scarecrow. It has an automatic result of 32 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary scarecrow.
bot.name: Mundane Appearance

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+4} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} negative and drain life

entries: Sceaduinars have neither souls nor the ability to create. A sceaduinar is immune to effects that target a soul (such as bind soul or resurrect) or that require knowledge of a creature's identity (such as scrying), and critically fails {@skill Crafting} checks.
mid.name: Void Child

mid.trigger: A creature attempts a melee attack against a sceaduinar or an
entries: {@skill Acrobatics} check to {@action Tumble Through} the sceaduinar's space; The sceaduinar flexes its wings to emit a brief pulse of negative energy that deals {@damage 4d6} negative damage to the triggering creature (DC 22 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Wing Flash

entries: When the sceaduinar damages a living creature with its jaws {@action Strike}, the sceaduinar gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the sceaduinar increases the {@condition drained} value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Drain Life

entries: Negative damage dealt by a sceaduinar damages undead and creatures with negative healing as if it were positive damage.
The sceaduinar's melee {@action Strike||Strikes} have the benefits of the {@item ghost touch} property rune on attacks against incorporeal undead.
bot.name: Entropic Touch

entries: A scythe tree takes 5 additional damage from axes.
mid.name: Axe Vulnerability

mid.trigger: A creature rolls a critical failure on a melee weapon {@action Strike} against the scythe tree
entries: The scythe tree attempts to {@action Disarm} the creature.
mid.name: Ripping Disarm

entries: Until the scythe tree acts, it appears to be a dead tree. It has an automatic result of 35 on {@skill Deception} checks and DCs to pass as a dead tree.
bot.name: Dead Tree

bot.requirements: The scythe tree is using Dead Tree in forested terrain, and a creature that hasn't detected it is within 30 feet
entries: The scythe tree {@action Stride||Strides} up to 25 feet toward the triggering creature. Once the creature is in reach, the scythe tree makes a scythe branch {@action Strike} against it. The creature is {@condition flat-footed} against this {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Woodland Ambush

mid.trigger: An adjacent creature deals piercing or slashing damage to the sea drake
entries: An arc of electricity courses through the sea drake's blood. The triggering creature takes {@damage 1d6} electricity damage.
mid.name: Electrified Blood

entries: The sea drake spews a ball of electricity that strikes a primary target within 100 feet, dealing {@damage 7d6} electricity damage (DC 24 basic Reflex save). The lightning then arcs to up to three secondary targets within 30 feet of the primary target, striking the closest available targets first. The secondary bolts each strike one secondary target and deal the same rolled damage value as the primary bolt (DC 22 basic Reflex save). The sea drake can't use Ball Lightning Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Ball Lightning Breath

entries: A sea drake's saliva carries a large quantity of salt, making its bite wounds even more painful. When a creature takes damage from a sea drake's jaws {@action Strike}, the creature must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save; the creature is then temporarily immune to briny wound for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition sickened 2} and {@condition slowed 1} as long as it's {@condition sickened}.

bot.name: Briny Wound

entries: The drake tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The drake must succeed at an {@skill Athletics} check with a DC of 25 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the drake) or the pilot's {@skill Lore||Sailing Lore} DC, whichever is higher.
bot.name: Capsize

entries: The sea drake makes one jaws {@action Strike} and two tail {@action Strike||Strikes} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy
Speed Surge
entries: The sea drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.
The sea snake can hold its breath for about an hour.
top.name: Deep Breath

mid.trigger: A creature within the sea snake's reach uses a move action
entries: The sea snake makes a bite {@action Strike} against the attacker.
mid.name: Lash Out

entries: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.
top.name: Shadow Blend

top.trigger: A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light
entries: The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a DC {@flatDC 11} flat check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were {@condition Hidden} for the triggering attack.
top.name: Shadow Evade

entries: The shadow drake makes one bite {@action Strike} and two tail {@action Strike||Strikes} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a 5-foot-radius burst.

Creatures within the burst take {@damage 3d6} cold damage (DC 18 basic Reflex save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a +10 counteract modifier. The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
bot.name: Shadow Breath
Speed Surge
entries: The shadow drake {@action Stride||Strides} or {@action Fly||Flies} twice.

When a shadow giant hits with a melee {@action Strike}, the target must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1} and take a –1 status penalty to {@skill Perception} checks involving sight as long as they remain {@condition drained}. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic.
bot.name: Pall of Shadow

entries: The shadow giant becomes shrouded in shadows and becomes {@condition concealed}. As the nature of this effect leaves the giant's location obvious, it can't use this concealment to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until it is exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first.
bot.name: Shadowcloak

entries: When a creature slays a shoal linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become cursed. As long as the curse of drowning persists, the character must spend 3 actions when drinking any liquid.
Attempting to drink liquid faster causes the victim to begin drowning, immediately running out of air and falling {@condition unconscious}.
mid.name: Curse of Drowning

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The shoal linnorm exhales scalding steam that deals {@damage 12d8} fire damage in a 60-foot cone (DC 36 basic Reflex save). The steam lingers until the end of the linnorm's next turn; anyone who enters the area or begins their turn in the area takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage (DC 36 Reflex save negates)

During this time, the steam is so thick that it impedes movement as well as sight, turning the area into {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. All creatures in the steam become {@condition concealed}, and all creatures outside the steam become {@condition concealed} to creatures within it. The shoal linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: A shocker lizard can sense minute electrical charges in living creatures, which it can use as a precise sense at a range of 20 feet. This distance increases to 100 feet against any creature that has used an {@trait electricity} effect within the last minute.
top.name: Greater Electrolocation

bot.trigger: A shocker lizard within 20 feet makes a shock {@action Strike} or uses Discharge
entries: The shocker lizard lends some of its electrical power to the nearby lizard. This either causes the other lizard's shock {@action Strike} to lose the {@trait nonlethal} trait or increases the DC of its Discharge to 20.
bot.name: Amplify Voltage

entries: The shocker lizard releases a blast of lightning from its body. Creatures within a 10-foot emanation take {@damage 3d6} electricity damage (DC 18 basic Reflex save). The shocker lizard can't use Discharge for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Discharge

entries: The shocker lizard hunkers down and begins to spark with electricity, which it releases in a 10-foot emanation that deals {@damage 3d8} electricity damage (DC 18 basic Reflex save). The shocker lizard can't use.
bot.name: Shocking Burst

entries: Burst again for 1 minute.

Up to four shocker lizards can combine their Shocking Bursts. In this case, the lizards can delay the release of their electricity until any other shocker lizard within 30 feet completes its Shocking Burst. The combined Shocking Bursts create an emanation with the combined area from all participating shocker lizards. For each additional shocker lizard that joins the burst, the damage increases by {@damage 3d8} and the save DC increases by 1 (to a maximum of four lizards dealing {@dice 12d8} damage with a DC 21 save).
bot.name: Shocking

entries: The shoggti caresses a creature with a tentacle and supernaturally erodes the creature's capability for thought as it does so. The target must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or become {@condition stupefied 2}, with an unlimited duration. The target can attempt the save to remove the {@condition stupefied} condition again once per day when it makes its daily preparations.
bot.name: Braincloud

entries: {@damage 1d10+8} bludgeoning, DC 25
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The shoggti writhes its tentacles and shifts its coloration to put on an unnaturally fascinating hypnotic display. Creatures in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a DC 25 Will save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Fascinating Displays for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated} for 1 minute. Once the fascination effect ends, the creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated} for 1 minute, can't use reactions while {@condition fascinated}, and is {@condition sickened 2} once the fascination ends.

bot.name: Fascinating Display

entries: A skaveling can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.
top.name: Echolocation

entries: The skaveling unleashes a horrifying screech that chills the very bones of those close enough to feel it.
The screech can be heard for miles, but each creature in a 20-foot emanation must also attempt a DC 22 Will save. The skaveling can't use Bone-Chilling Screech again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Bone-

bot.name: Bone-Chilling Screech

entries: Screech for 24 hours.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition frightened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition frightened 2} and {@condition stunned 1} by fear.

bot.name: Chilling

stages.entry: {@damage 2d6} negative damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing
{@damage 2d6} negative damage and gains no benefit from healing

entries: Any creature hit by the skaveling's {@action Strike||Strikes} must attempt a DC 22 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition slowed 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each save. into a standard potion of flying.

bot.name: Paralysis

entries: A flying skrik nettle can detect the movement of nearby creatures and objects from the tiny gusts of wind created by their movements. This is a precise sense at the listed range, but it works only against creatures and objects that moved through air in the previous round.
top.name: Motionsense

mid.trigger: The skrik nettle takes piercing or slashing damage
entries: The skrik nettle ejects its venom onto an adjacent creature. That creature is exposed to skrik nettle venom.
mid.name: Spill Venom

entries: The skrik nettle attempts to counteract (with a modifier of +17) a single effect currently levitating a creature it can detect with its motionsense.
bot.name: Negate Levitation

entries: The skulk gains the benefit of the {@action Cover Tracks} action in forests and subterranean settings without moving at half Speed.
top.name: Camouflaged Step

entries: The skulk's skin shifts and changes to match the surroundings. As long as most of their body is not covered by clothing or armor, the skulk gains a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks to {@action Hide}.
top.name: Chameleon Skin

entries: A skulk's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an extra {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: An amoeba swarm can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: The snapping turtle can hold its breath for 30 minutes.
top.name: Deep Breath

bot.requirements: The snapping turtle damaged a creature with a jaws
entries: {@action Strike} in its previous action; The snapping turtle clenches its jaws down and automatically deals an additional {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage to the creature it just bit.
bot.name: Clench Jaws

entries: The snapping turtle retracts its limbs and head into its shell and ends its turn. This increases its AC to 18, but it can't act except to reemerge, which it can do as a single action.
bot.name: Shell Defense

attacks.name: holy longbow
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d8+17} piercing plus {@damage 2d6} good and arrow of mortality

entries: 20 feet. Allies in the solar's aura gain a +2 status bonus to AC against evil creatures and a +2 status bonus to saves against effects from evil creatures. The bonus increases to +4 against control by evil creatures and attacks by evil summoned creatures. When the solar or an ally is hit by an attack from a creature in the aura, that foe must succeed at a DC 43 Will save or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute (this is an {@trait incapacitation} effect). It's then temporarily immune for 1 minute.
mid.name: Aura of Protection

bot.trigger: The solar hits with a melee weapon
entries: {@action Strike} while Animate Weapon is not already in effect; The solar's weapon leaps into the air and moves with the solar as if held with both hands. The weapon gains the effects of the dancing weapon rune for 1 minute.
bot.name: Animate Weapon

entries: The solar doesn't need to provide ammunition for their bow. When they draw their bow, they create a magical arrow of light that sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius until the end of the solar's next turn. On a critical hit with the arrow, if the target has 75 or fewer Hit Points after taking the damage, it drops to 0 Hit Points and becomes {@condition dying 1} (or, if it was already {@condition dying}, increases its {@condition dying} value by 3).
bot.name: Arrow of Mortality

entries: The solar can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or {@action Strike||Strikes}.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: Any weapon gains the effect of a holy property rune while a solar wields it.
bot.name: Holy Armaments

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6+3} slashing plus {@damage 2d6} negative and mind-numbing touch

entries: A conjured soul eater forms a mental link with its conjurer. While both are on the same plane, the soul eater knows the location of its conjurer per its find target ability. If the soul eater's target dies before the soul eater can drain its soul, or if the soul eater is defeated (but not destroyed) by the target, the soul eater returns to its conjurer and tries to kill them.
top.name: Caster Link

entries: When a soul eater is conjured to the Material Plane to find a specific creature, it gains the benefits of a 5th-level {@spell locate} spell that isn't blocked by lead or running water. The conjurer must have seen the target and must speak the target's name while conjuring the soul eater in order to grant this ability.
top.name: Find Target

bot.requirements: The soul eater is adjacent to a {@condition dying} creature
entries: The soul eater attempts to devour the {@condition dying} creature's soul. The creature must attempt a DC 25 Will save. A creature that dies as a result of Drain Soul can't be restored to life except by a spell or ritual of 8th level or higher. If the soul eater that used Drain Soul on a creature is slain within 100 feet of that creature's corpse and the creature has been dead no longer than 1 minute, the creature's soul returns to its body and is restored to life, leaving the creature {@condition unconscious} and {@condition dying 1} but no longer {@condition doomed}.

entries.Success: The creature becomes {@condition doomed 1}, or increases its {@condition doomed} value by 1 if it was already {@condition doomed}.
entries.Failure: As success, but {@condition doomed 2}.
entries.Critical Failure: As success, but {@condition doomed 3}.

bot.name: Drain Soul

entries: When a soul eater hits a creature with its claw {@action Strike}, the creature must succeed at a DC 23 Fortitude save or become {@condition stupefied 1} ({@condition stupefied 2} on a critical failure). Further damage dealt by the soul eater increases the {@condition stupefied} value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}. This condition value decreases by 1 each time the creature gets a full night's rest. As long as the creature is {@condition stupefied} by a soul eater, rest does not decrease any {@condition doomed} value that creature might have.
bot.name: Mind-Numbing Touch

entries: [(move, electricity, primal, transmutation) The spark bat transforms into lightning that arcs to a large piece of metal within 100 feet, such as a suit of metal armor or a metal weapon. The bat then returns to its normal form in a space adjacent to the metal. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Arc Lightning

entries: Anytime a creature touches the spear frog or an adjacent creature {@action Strike||Strikes} the spear frog with a melee attack, that creature is exposed to spear frog venom.
mid.name: Toxic Skin

entries: Spear frogs are not {@condition flat-footed} when Balancing on a narrow surface, and they gain a +4 bonus to Reflex saves to avoid falling.
bot.name: Sticky Feet

entries: 30 feet, DC 22
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: A specter that goes for more than a month without dealing negative damage to a living humanoid becomes desperate and almost feral. It changes alignment from lawful evil to chaotic evil, loses control of any corrupted thralls it might have, and becomes {@condition quickened}. It can use its additional action only to make vile touch {@action Strike||Strikes} against humanoid targets.

At the end of any turn in which it deals any amount of negative damage to a living humanoid, it reverts to lawful evil and is no longer {@condition quickened}, but any thralls it lost control of remain free.
mid.name: Pain Starvation

entries: A specter caught in sunlight is {@condition clumsy 2} and {@condition slowed 2} for as long as it remains in the sunlight.
mid.name: Sunlight Powerlessness

entries: When the specter damages a living creature with its vile touch {@action Strike}, the specter gains 5 temporary Hit Points and the target creature must attempt a DC 25 Will save to avoid becoming corrupted.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to spectral corruption for 1 minute.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stupefied 2} for 1 hour.
entries.Failure: The creature succumbs to the corruption and becomes a spectral thrall. The creature is {@condition controlled} by the specter, obeying the specter's telepathic or spoken orders, though a spectral thrall does not obey obviously self-destructive orders. It can attempt a new Will save at the end of each of its turns; on a success, it is no longer {@condition controlled} by the specter but becomes {@condition stupefied 2} for 1 hour.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature remains a thrall to the specter until the curse is removed or until the specter succumbs to pain starvation; it can't attempt new Will saves to recover on its own. called shiver (Gamemastery Guide

bot.name: Spectral Corruption

resistances.name: all
resistances.note: except force, {@item ghost touch}, or positive; double resistance vs. non-magical

entries: A spinosaurus can hold its breath for 2 hours.
top.name: Deep Breath

bot.requirements: The spinosaurus has a creature {@condition grabbed} in its jaws
entries: The spinosaurus reaches up and slashes with its claws at the creature it has {@condition grabbed}, dealing {@damage 4d8} slashing damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save) and {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}.
bot.name: Rip and Tear

bot.requirements: The spinosaurus is swimming on the surface of water
entries: With a powerful lunge to the side, the spinosaurus uses its sail to slap the surface of the water, creating a crushing wave of water that deals {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the water in the area must attempt a DC 30 Reflex save.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition stunned 3}.

bot.name: Staggering Sail

entries: Medium, {@damage 2d12+12} bludgeoning, Rupture 19.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: A spiral centurion's top-like design makes it susceptible to effects that would cause it to fall {@condition prone}. The DC of any attempt to knock the spiral centurion {@condition prone} is reduced by 5. If the spiral centurion attempts a check or saving throw to resist being knocked {@condition prone}, it takes a –5 status penalty. A spiral centurion that has been knocked {@condition prone} can't use any actions other than to attempt to {@action Stand}, but it must succeed at a DC 30 {@skill Acrobatics} check to do so.
mid.name: Top-Heavy

entries: The spiral centurion hurls one of its blades with an angled spin to ensure a swooping flight path. The blade deals {@damage 6d6} slashing damage to each creature in a 40-foot line (DC 30 basic Reflex save). At the start of the spiral centurion's next turn, the blade swoops around and returns along the same flight path, again dealing {@damage 6d6} slashing damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save) to each creature along the same line.
bot.name: Hurl Blade

bot.requirements: The spiral centurion has not acted yet this turn
entries: The spiral centurion {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed. It then gains a +2 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls until the end of its turn.
bot.name: Rev Up

entries: Medium or smaller, blade, DC 30
bot.name: Trample

entries: The spiral centurion spins furiously in place, its blades extended to slice through nearby creatures. It makes up to five melee blade {@action Strike||Strikes}. No single creature can be targeted by more than one blade {@action Strike} during one use of this ability. These attacks count toward the spiral centurion's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks are made.
bot.name: Whirling Death

entries: A spirit naga adds hallucination, mind probe, and suggestion to their coven's spells.
top.name: Coven

mid.trigger: A creature in the sportlebore swarm's area speaks, uses a verbal component, or opens its mouth
entries: A portion of the sportlebore swarm attempts to surge down the throat of the triggering creature, which must attempt a DC 25 Fortitude save.

entries.Success: The creature gets a mouthful of sportlebores. It spits the insects out and avoids further damage, but it can't speak for 1 round, and if it was performing a verbal spellcasting action, the spell fails and the caster wastes the action.
entries.Failure: The creature takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage from sportlebore bites, can't speak for 1 round, and loses a spell as noted under Success.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature is also exposed to sportlebore infestation.

mid.name: Pour Down Throat

entries: Each creature in the sportlebore swarm's area takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage (DC 25 basic Reflex save).
bot.name: Swarming Bites

mid.trigger: The spriggan bully takes damage
entries: The spriggan bully grows to Large size, along with their equipment (which returns to natural size if removed). The spriggan bully's reach increases by 5 feet. They regain 5 Hit Points and gain a +2 status bonus to melee attacks and damage rolls. This effect continues until the end of the spriggan bully's next turn, but on any turn in which the spriggan bully deals damage to another creature and is not {@condition fatigued}, the effect extends until the end of the following turn. When Enraged Growth ends, the spriggan bully is {@condition fatigued} for 1 hour.
mid.name: Enraged Growth

entries: The spriggan bully makes a morningstar {@action Strike} with a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. This attack is nonlethal.
bot.name: Bully's Bludgeon

entries: The spriggan bully's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

mid.trigger: The spriggan warlord takes damage
entries: The spriggan warlord grows to size Large, along with their equipment (which returns to natural size if removed). The spriggan warlord's reach increases by 5 feet. They regain 15 Hit Points and gain a +2 status bonus to melee attack and damage rolls. This effect continues until the end of the spriggan warlord's next turn, but on any turn in which the spriggan warlord deals damage to another creature and is not {@condition fatigued}, the effect extends until the end of the following turn. When Enraged Growth ends, the spriggan warlord is {@condition fatigued} for 1 hour.
mid.name: Enraged Growth

entries: The spriggan warlord makes a morningstar {@action Strike} with a +2 circumstance bonus to its attack roll. This attack is nonlethal.
bot.name: Bully's Bludgeon

entries: The spriggan warlord's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 2d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: A spriggan warlord has access to the critical specialization effects for crossbows and morningstars, and the reload of any crossbow they wield is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0).
bot.name: Warlord's Training

entries: Whenever the star archon takes slashing damage, bright light pours from their wounds. Non-archons within 10 feet must attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save. On a failure, a creature is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is {@condition blinded} for {@dice 1d4} rounds instead. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 round.
mid.name: Blinding Soul

entries: When killed, the star archon explodes in a blinding flash of holy energy that deals {@damage 12d6} fire damage and {@damage 12d6} good damage to anything in a 100-foot emanation, with a DC 40 basic Reflex save. A non-archon creature that sees the explosion and critically fails its save is permanently {@condition blinded} as well. The slain star archon reincarnates {@dice 1d4} rounds later as a shield archon (Bestiary 29).
mid.name: Explosive Rebirth

entries: A star archon can also make a {@action Retributive Strike} by throwing its starknife, and the enemy and ally can be within 60 feet instead of 15 feet.
mid.name: Retributive Strike

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, the archon can use dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either creature used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: The star archon calculates a celestial constellation and sends their starknife flying along that path from one foe to the next. It makes a starknife {@action Strike} against a target within 60 feet. If the {@action Strike} hits, it can make another {@action Strike} at a different target within 60 feet of the first target, and so on, until it misses with a {@action Strike} or runs out of targets it hasn't attacked within range of the most recent target. The star archon can attack a given target only once per use of this ability. These attacks don't apply any range increment penalty, and the star archon resolves all the attacks before increasing the multiple attack penalty.
bot.name: Prudent Asterism

entries: The steam mephit ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from mist and steam.
top.name: Steam Vision

entries: Frequency once per day; The steam mephit calls down a rain boiling water that surrounds them in a 10-foot emanation.
Creatures in the area take {@damage 2d8} fire damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save), and small unattended flames (such as {@item torch||torches}) are extinguished.
bot.name: Boiling Rain

entries: The steam mephit spits a cloud of steam in a 15-foot cone that deals {@damage 2d6} fire damage to each creature within the area (DC 17 basic Reflex save). The steam mephit can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: Water elementals that become infused with cold or mist have increased mobility in regions outside of bodies of water.
bot.name: Elemental, Water

abilities: fast healing 2 (in boiling water or steam)

entries: A stingray in water can use its electrolocation as an imprecise sense at the listed range to detect living creatures that are in the same body of water as itself.
top.name: Electrolocation

entries: The striding fire ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from smoke.
top.name: Smoke Vision

entries: The striding fire {@action Stride||Strides} up to double its Speed in a straight line. Its movement during this {@action Stride} doesn't trigger reactions. Any creature the striding fire was adjacent to at any point during this {@action Stride} must attempt a DC 24 basic Reflex save. If it critically fails, it is knocked {@condition prone} by a wave of heated air. The striding fire can't use Burning Rush for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Burning Rush

entries: As long as the stygira holds a gemstone, they can see through the gem with {@ability darkvision} and the effects of true seeing. The stygira is blind when they are not holding a gem in a hand.
top.name: Gemsight

entries: A stygira in an area of bright light is {@condition sickened 1}.
mid.name: Light Sickness

entries: The stygira holds aloft a gem and gazes into the mind of a creature within 30 feet, infusing the creature's thoughts with visions of the creature's own dead body slowly petrifying.
The creature must succeed at a DC 25 Will save or become {@condition frightened 1} ({@condition frightened 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Gem Gaze

entries: Wounds dealt by the stygira's claws leave the flesh bleached of color and turn the blood that runs from them dark gray. Each time a creature is damaged by the stygira's claw {@action Strike}, it must succeed at a DC 25 Fortitude save or become permanently {@condition slowed 1} ({@condition slowed 2} on a critical failure) as its flesh stiffens like stone. If a creature is reduced to 0 Hit Points from the stygira's claw {@action Strike} and fails the saving throw against stone curse, it is {@condition petrified}. A creature that spends 8 hours in direct sunlight can attempt a new saving throw to remove the effects of stone curse, even if it has been {@condition petrified}.
bot.name: Stone Curse

mid.trigger: An enemy is about to damage the dune dancer with cold, electricity, or fire, or with a spell that has the air, earth, {@trait fire}, or {@trait water} trait
entries: The dune dancer gain resistance 2 against the triggering damage.
mid.name: Elemental Bulwark

entries: Elemental magic fills the dune dancer's body or weapon. The dune dancer chooses one element and makes a melee {@action Strike}. The Strike deals an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of the indicated type and has the trait corresponding to the element: {@b Air} electricity, {@b Earth} bludgeoning, {@b Fire} fire, or {@b Water} cold.
bot.name: Elemental Assault

mid.requirements: The sunflower leshy begins its turn in an area of bright light
entries: The sunflower leshy reflects the sun or another source of bright light from their face. Each creature that ends its turn in a 20-foot emanation must attempt a DC 16 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to heliotrope for 24 hours.
entries.Failure: The creature is distracted by the light, becoming {@condition flat-footed} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature is also {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.

mid.name: Heliotrope

entries: When a sunflower leshy dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body, restoring {@dice 1d8} Hit Points to each plant creature in a 30-foot emanation.
This area immediately fills with sunflowers, becoming {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain}. If the terrain is not a viable environment for these sunflowers, they wither after 24 hours.
mid.name: Verdant Burst

entries: The sunflower leshy transforms into a Small flower. This ability otherwise uses the effects of tree shape.
bot.name: Change Shape

entries: The sunflower leshy launches a deluge of seeds from their head in a 15-foot cone, dealing {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures within the area (DC 16 basic Reflex save). It gains a +2 status bonus to this damage against {@condition dazzled} creatures. The sunflower leshy can't use Seed Spray again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Seed Spray

mid.trigger: The sylph sneak is the target of a physical ranged attack
mid.requirements: The sylph sneak is aware of the attack
entries: A swift gale whips up between the sylph sneak and the source of the ranged attack, giving the sneak a +3 status bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the attack misses, the wind deflected it. The wind can't deflect unusually large or heavy ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts).
mid.name: Deflecting Gale

entries: The sylph sneak's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal {@dice 1d6} extra precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

entries: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are {@condition flat-footed} to the sylph sneak.
bot.name: Surprise Attacker

entries: When the sylph sneak attacks with a thrown weapon, the range increment increases by 10 feet.
bot.name: Wind's Guidance

entries: A taiga giant can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as translucent shapes, and they are {@condition concealed} to the taiga giant.
top.name: See Invisibility

mid.trigger: The taiga giant has Ancestral Guardian active and would take energy or mental damage
entries: The taiga giant's ancestral spirits intervene and protect the giant from taking up to 20 energy damage or 30 mental damage. The giant takes any remaining damage; if it does, the spirits depart and the giant is no longer protected by the ancestors.
mid.name: Guardian Spirit

bot.requirements: The taiga giant must be protected by the ancestors
entries: The taiga giant calls upon their ancestors' spirits to rise up and protect them, causing a cloak of spectral faces to shimmer and swirl around them. The taiga giant's AC increases to 34 until the start of its next turn. Protected by the Ancestors (divine) A taiga giant's prayers to their ancestors grant them spiritual protection. If a taiga giant loses this protection (such as by taking too much damage when using Guardian Spirit, or if the ancestors are counteracted by dispel magic), it loses its immunity to the {@condition controlled} condition and its status bonus to saving throws against {@trait enchantment} and {@trait illusion} effects. A taiga giant can once again be Protected by the Ancestors by performing a 10-minute prayer as an activity that has the {@trait concentrate} trait.
bot.name: Ancestral Guardian

entries: When a creature slays a taiga linnorm, it must succeed at a DC 46 Will save or permanently gain weakness 20 to electricity.
mid.name: Curse of Endless Storms

entries: Any creature that makes a melee attack against a taiga linnorm is stabbed by the taiga linnorm's spines and takes {@damage 1d6} piercing damage per attack. A melee weapon with reach protects the user against these spines.
mid.name: Spines

entries: Tail only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

entries: The taiga linnorm breathes a 60-foot cone of electrified vapor, dealing {@damage 20d6} electricity damage to creatures in the area (DC 41 basic Reflex save). The electrified mist persists for {@dice 1d4} rounds, dealing {@damage 6d6} electricity damage (DC 41 basic Reflex save) to each creature that ends its turn in the mist. The taiga linnorm can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: A tatzlwyrm's green, gray, and brown scales provide it natural camouflage. In areas of dense undergrowth, a tatzlwyrm can move at its full Speed when Sneaking, and it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to {@action Hide}.
top.name: Natural Camouflage

entries: The tatzlwyrm belches a puff of poisonous vapor into the face of an adjacent creature, which must attempt a DC 15 Fortitude save; the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to this save if it's {@condition grabbed} or {@condition flat-footed}. The tatzlwyrm can't use Poison Gasp again for 2 rounds.

entries.Success: The target is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The target takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and is {@condition enfeebled 1} for 1 round.
entries.Critical Failure: The target takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage and is {@condition enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

bot.name: Poison Gasp

entries: Tentacle only.
mid.name: Attack of Opportunity

bot.requirements: A creature the tendriculos has Swallowed
entries: Whole has taken damage since the end of the tendriculos's last turn, and the tendriculos hasn't used any other actions this turn; The tendriculos regains {@dice 3d8} HP and recovers from the {@condition fatigued} and {@condition slowed} conditions. It reduces any {@condition enfeebled} value it has by 2.
bot.name: Rampant Growth

entries: Large, {@damage 2d10+7} acid plus tendriculos venom, Rupture 14.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

attacks.name: bo staff
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+14} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} negative, {@damage 1d6} evil, and draining strike

attacks.name: claw
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d6+14} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and draining strike

spells.name: plane shift
notes: self plus skiff and passengers only
Astral, Ethereal and evil planes only

entries: 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 30 Will save. If the creature fails, it becomes {@condition frightened 2}. The creature is then temporarily immune to terrifying gaze (but not Focus Gaze) for 24 hours.
mid.name: Terrifying Gaze

entries: When a thanadaemon damages a living creature with a melee {@action Strike}, the creature must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or become {@condition drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the thanadaemon increases the {@condition drained} condition value by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}.
bot.name: Draining Strike

entries: The thanadaemon glares at a single creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a DC 33 Will save against the thanadaemon's terrifying gaze. If the target was already {@condition frightened}, a failed save causes it to become {@condition fleeing} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. After attempting its save, the creature is temporarily immune to this ability until the start of the thanadaemon's next turn.
bot.name: Focus Gaze

bot.requirements: The thanadaemon has a soul gem
entries: The thanadaemon crushes the soul gem in one hand and gains fast healing 15 for 1 minute.
bot.name: Soul Crush

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d8+4} slashing plus {@damage 1d6} lawful and fate drain

entries: When a theletos conveys information, it does so wordlessly through psychic projections. This acts as telepathy with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language. The meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. A theletos can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane.
top.name: Envisioning

entries: A creature damaged by the theletos's tentacle must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or become {@condition stupefied 1}. As long as the creature is {@condition stupefied}, it can no longer benefit from {@trait fortune} effects. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.
bot.name: Fate Drain

entries: The theletos releases a 60-foot cone of energy from its center.

Creatures in the cone become overwhelmed with the knowledge of various fates that destiny has in store for them and lack of clear pathways to these potential futures. They must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be {@condition slowed 1} indefinitely. An affected creature can choose to roll twice when it attempts an attack, saving throw, or skill check and take the lower result.
Regardless of the outcome, that creature is no longer {@condition slowed} after that roll. The theletos can't use Wrath of Fate again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Wrath of Fate

entries: The thrasfyr always treats the plane it is located on as its home plane.
top.name: Planar Acclimation

attacks.name: stinger
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d12+17} piercing plus {@damage 3d6} mental, {@damage 1d6} chaotic, and thulgant venom

attacks.name: tentacle
attacks.damage: {@damage 3d8+17} bludgeoning plus {@damage 2d6} acid, {@damage 1d6} chaotic, and Grab

entries: The thulgant causes a demon within 30 feet to suffer the effect of its sinful vulnerability.
bot.name: Demon Hunter

entries: {@damage 2d6+17} bludgeoning and {@damage 1d6} acid, DC 40
bot.name: Greater Constrict

bot.requirements: The thulgant hits the same enemy with two consecutive sting {@action Strike||Strikes} in the same round
entries: The thulgant deals {@damage 3d12+17} mental damage to the enemy. If the enemy is affected by thulgant venom, that poison gains the {@trait virulent} trait.
bot.name: Mind-Rending Sting

entries: The thulgant rises up on its twitching limbs and presents its numerous tentacles and stingers in a horrifying display of awfulness.
Creatures in a 30-foot emanation must attempt a DC 40 Will save, after which they are temporarily immune to further Stunning Displays for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stunned 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 4}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 8}.

bot.name: Stunning Display

stages.entry: {@damage 3d6} poison damage and the victim gains one of the following at random: {@condition clumsy 1}, {@condition enfeebled 1}, or {@condition stupefied 1}
{@damage 6d6} poison damage and the victim gains two of the following at random: {@condition clumsy 2}, {@condition enfeebled 2}, or {@condition stupefied 2}
{@damage 9d6} poison damage and the victim gains all three of the following: {@condition clumsy 3}, {@condition enfeebled 3}, and {@condition stupefied 3}

entries: Wind, precipitation, and clouds don't impair a thunderbird's vision; it ignores the {@condition concealed} condition from storms, mist, precipitation, and the like.
top.name: Stormsight

entries: 100 feet. The thunderbird is surrounded by a cyclone of wind and driving rain. This area is {@quickref greater difficult terrain||3|terrain} for flying creatures, who must successfully {@action Maneuver in Flight} (DC 27) or be blown 30 feet away from the thunderbird. Creatures on the ground must succeed at a DC 27 Reflex save to perform any move action and are knocked {@condition prone} on a critical failure. The driving rain in the storm aura imposes a –2 circumstance penalty on {@skill Perception} checks and extinguishes smaller flames. A thunderbird can deactivate or activate the storm aura as a free action with the {@trait concentrate} trait.
mid.name: Storm Aura

mid.trigger: A creature enters the thunderbird's reach or uses a move action within their reach
entries: A lightning bolt dancing on the thunderbird's body leaps onto the creature, dealing {@damage 8d6} electricity damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save).
mid.name: Reactive Shock

entries: The thunderbird spreads their wings and blasts their foe with thunderous bolts of lightning.
Each creature in a 30-foot emanation takes {@damage 6d6} electricity damage and {@damage 6d6} sonic damage (DC 30 basic Reflex save). The thunderbird can't use Lightning Blast for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Lightning Blast

entries: A thunderbird can move in wind with ease. They don't treat wind as {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} or need to {@action Maneuver in Flight} in high winds.
bot.name: Stormflight

entries: A creature that takes damage from a thunderbird's thunderbolt {@action Strike} must succeed at a DC 28 Fortitude save or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition deafened} for 1 round.
bot.name: Thunderstrike

mid.trigger: A creature leaves the swarm's space
entries: The swarm takes {@dice 1d6} damage as ticks cling to the creature and continue biting, dealing {@damage 3d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent piercing damage}. Immersion in water reduces the DC of the flat check to end this {@condition persistent damage} to 5, and any area damage dealt to the creature destroys these clinging ticks.
mid.name: Cling

entries: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes {@damage 3d6} piercing damage (DC 28 basic Reflex save) plus Cling and exposure to tick fever.
bot.name: Swarming Bites

entries: As giant tick but DC 27.
bot.name: Tick Fever

entries: When a titan centipede scores a critical hit with its mandibles, the target is painfully pierced with barbed spines and bristles, taking {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and becoming {@condition flat-footed} as long as the bleed damage continues.
bot.name: Impaling Critical

entries: Huge or smaller, foot, DC 28
bot.name: Trample

entries: The titan centipede {@action Stride||Strides} up to its Speed or {@action Step||Steps}.
During this movement, it can pass through spaces as narrow as 10 feet without {@action Squeeze||Squeezing}.
bot.name: Undulate

bot.requirements: The totenmaske hit the same enemy with two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} this turn and is still adjacent to it
entries: The totenmaske drains flesh from the creature's body. The creature becomes {@condition sickened 2} and {@condition drained 1} unless it succeeds at a DC 25 Fortitude save ({@condition sickened 2} and {@condition drained 2} on a critical failure).
bot.name: Drink Flesh

entries: The totenmaske takes the appearance of a Medium or smaller humanoid creature. This is either its form from before it became undead, or the form of the last creature it successfully hit with Drink Flesh. This doesn't change the totenmaske's Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for its {@action Strike|Strikes}, but might change the damage type its {@action Strike|Strikes} deal (typically to bludgeoning).
bot.name: Living Form

entries: The triton Interacts to raise their trident, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn. During this time, any of their allies also gains the bonus while adjacent to the triton.
bot.name: Defender of the Seas

entries: The triton blows into a conch shell, casting a 2ndlevel {@spell summon animal} spell. The triton can summon only an aquatic creature, such as a dolphin (page 84), octopus (page 187), ray (page 226), sea snake (page 245), or electric eel (Bestiary 142). This creature remains until it is slain, the triton Dismisses it, or the triton summons another ally.
bot.name: Summon Aquatic Ally

attacks.name: jaws
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d12+4} piercing plus Knockdown and bloodfire fever

entries: The trollhound deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage to any creature within reach of at least two of the trollhound's allies.
bot.name: Pack Attack

entries: Once per day, if an archon sees another creature cast {@spell dimension door}, the archon can use dimension door (heightened to 5th level) within 1 round to attempt to follow that creature to the maximum distance of the archon's dimension door. If the archon's dimension door has enough distance, the archon appears the same distance and direction from the creature as before either creature used dimension door.
bot.name: Archon's Door

entries: The trumpet archon offers an ally praise or encouragement. The archon attempts to counteract one {@trait emotion} effect on the ally (with a counteract modifier of +24), and the archon and the ally both gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws for 1 round.
bot.name: Kind Word

entries: The trumpet archon blows mightily on their horn, creating a tone of such beauty and grandeur those who hear it are {@condition paralyzed} in awe. Non-archons within 100 feet must attempt a DC 34 Fortitude save.
They are temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

entries.Success: The creature is {@condition flat-footed}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition stunned 1} and {@condition flat-footed} as long as it's {@condition stunned}.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 round.

bot.name: Trumpet Blast

bot.requirements: The twigjack is in undergrowth
entries: The twigjack scrambles into the undergrowth and instantly teleports to a square of undergrowth within 60 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
bot.name: Bramble Jump

entries: The twigjack sprays a barrage of splinters and brambles from its body in a 15-foot cone, dealing {@damage 4d6} piercing damage (DC 20 basic Reflex save). It can't use Splinter Spray again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
bot.name: Splinter Spray

entries: Each of a two-headed troll's heads rolls their own initiative and has their own turn. Neither head can {@action Delay}. At the start of a head's turn, that head gets 2 actions and 1 reaction. Each brain controls one of the troll's arms, but both can move the legs. Any ability that would sever a two-headed troll's head (such as the vorpal weapon property) doesn't cause the two-headed troll to die if they still have their other head, but does cause them to lose the turns, actions, and reactions of the severed head.
Mental effects that target a single creature affect only one of the troll's heads.
top.name: Independent Brains

entries: A two-headed troll's regeneration can regrow a severed head. After regaining Hit Points from regeneration, the two-headed troll attempts a DC {@flatDC 10} flat check. On a success, the missing head is fully restored. If a two-headed troll loses their last remaining head, they die immediately.
mid.name: Head Regrowth

bot.requirements: One of the troll's heads hit the same enemy with two consecutive claw {@action Strike||Strikes} in the same round
entries: The other head uses their reaction to make a jaws {@action Strike} against the creature that was hit.
bot.name: Reactive Chomp

entries: The umonlee breathes a cone of extremely cold air that damages its prey and can freeze them to the ground. Its breath deals {@damage 12d8} cold damage to creatures in the 50-foot cone (DC 38 Reflex save). The umonlee can't use Freezing Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition slowed 1} for 1 round. If the creature is standing on the ground, it's {@condition immobilized} as thick ice forms around it, and it can't recover from being {@condition slowed}. The creature remains {@condition immobilized} and {@condition slowed 1} until it manages to {@action Escape} (DC 36) or deal 30 damage to the ice, which has weakness 10 to fire.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, except the creature takes double damage and the ice holding it in place requires 60 damage to break.

bot.name: Freezing Breath

entries: {@damage 2d10+8} bludgeoning, DC 36
bot.name: Greater Constrict

entries: When an urdefhan dies, its {@condition invisible} flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a 5-foot emanation around the body. This gas deals {@damage 5d6} negative damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (DC 21 basic Fortitude save).
mid.name: Necrotic Decay

entries: When an urdefhan dies, its {@condition invisible} flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a 5-foot emanation around the body. This gas deals {@damage 3d6} negative damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (DC 17 basic Fortitude save).
mid.name: Necrotic Decay

entries: The urdefhan makes one rhoka sword {@action Strike} and one jaws {@action Strike} against a single creature. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.
bot.name: Ravenous Attack

bot.requirements: The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws {@action Strike} on its last action
entries: The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a DC 20 Fortitude save. If the jaws {@action Strike} was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

items: {@bold Drain Blood} The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition drained 1} and the urdefhan regains 5 HP (or, on a critical failure, it's {@condition drained 2} and the urdefhan regains 10 HP).

{@bold Drain Vitality} (necromancy) The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes {@condition enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or {@condition enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

bot.name: Wicked Bite

bot.requirements: The vampire squid is in water
entries: The vampire squid ejects a cloud of bioluminescent mucus in a 15-foot cone. Non-squid creatures within the cloud must attempt a DC 16 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1}. The glowing mucus remains in the area for 1 minute, and any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed at a DC 13 Fortitude save or become {@condition sickened 1}.
bot.name: Glowing Mucus

attacks.name: misty tendril
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d6} slashing damage plus {@damage 1d6} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage} and blood siphon

entries: A vampiric mist's body is composed of a semisolid red mist similar in consistency to thick foam. This enables a vampiric mist to move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch in diameter with no reduction to its Speed. However, a vampiric mist can't wear or interact with objects. It also can't enter water or other fluids, and it's treated as Tiny for the purpose of how wind affects it.
top.name: Misty Form

entries: A vampiric mist can sense creatures that have blood within 60 feet.
It can sense exposed blood within a mile.
top.name: Sense Blood

entries: When a vampiric mist damages a creature with a misty tendril {@action Strike}, the creature must attempt a DC 20 Fortitude save. If the {@action Strike} was a critical hit, the outcome of the creature's save is one degree worse than the result of the saving throw.
Any temporary Hit Points the vampiric mist gains from Blood Siphon fade after 1 hour.
