entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition drained 1}, and the vampiric mist gains 5 temporary Hit Points.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature is {@condition drained 2}. The vampiric mist gains 10 temporary Hit Points and takes on an intense red until the end of its next turn. During this time, it gains a +2 status bonus to AC and saves and is {@condition quickened}. It can use its extra action only to {@action Strike}.

bot.name: Blood Siphon

entries: 20 feet, DC 22
mid.name: Frightful Presence

entries: A vanth's scythe is its symbol of office and gains a measure of its personal power. This scythe becomes a +1 scythe and is treated as if it were adamantine while the vanth wields it. A vanth whose scythe is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.
bot.name: Infuse Weapon

entries: A vanth's {@action Strike||Strikes} affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a {@item ghost touch} property rune and deal {@damage 2d6} negative damage to living creatures and {@damage 2d6} positive damage to undead.
bot.name: Spirit Touch

entries: The vanth bestows a curse on a creature by touching it with its scythe. The creature must attempt a DC 25 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Vanth's Curse for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The target feels a momentary shudder of doom and is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 minute by the distracting sensation.
entries.Failure: The target becomes morose and glum as it accepts its own inevitable fate. For 1 hour, the target is {@condition stupefied 2}. Each time the target gains the {@condition dying} condition, the {@condition stupefied} condition value increases by 1, to a maximum value of {@condition stupefied 4}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the effect is permanent.

bot.name: Vanth's Curse

entries: 30 feet. A vaspercham's shell distorts nearby magic. Any creature in the aura who {@action Cast a Spell||Casts a Spell} must attempt a DC 37 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The spell is unaffected and the caster is temporarily immune to the magic-warping aura for 1 minute.
entries.Success: The spell is unaffected, but if the spell allows a saving throw, the vaspercham gains a +1 circumstance bonus to save against it.
entries.Failure: If the spell has a target and there are one or more viable targets within its range, the spell's target changes, determined randomly by the GM. If there is no other possible target within range or the spell has no target, the spell is disrupted.
entries.Critical Failure: The caster instead Casts another Spell, choosing randomly from their spell repertoire, prepared spells, or available focus spells (as appropriate) and selecting any targets at random.

mid.name: Magic-Warping Aura

entries: A creature hit by the vaspercham's {@action Strike||Strikes} or Mindwarping Tide must attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature is overwhelmed with phantasmal visions, becoming {@condition confused} for 1 round (1 minute on a critical failure).
bot.name: Hallucinatory Brine

entries: The vaspercham releases an effusion of noxious water from its shell. Creatures within a 15-foot emanation must save against the vaspercham's hallucinatory brine.
bot.name: Mindwarping Tide

entries: The vaspercham makes four tentacle {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the vaspercham's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the vaspercham makes all of their attacks.
bot.name: Whipping Tentacles

attacks.name: vine
attacks.damage: {@damage 4d12+16} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} good and {@ability Improved Grab}

entries: The veranallia dramatically alters weather patterns in the surrounding area, producing any of the results of a successful 9th-level control weather ritual.
bot.name: Alter Weather

entries: The veranallia spends a minute to encase a creature that has been dead for no more than a year in a cocoon. After 24 hours, the creature is restored to life, and the cocoon explodes in a shower of colorful blossoms. If the veranallia's chooses, Rebirth can change the creature's ancestry or heritage, typically into an aasimar.
bot.name: Rebirth

entries: An amoeba swarm can sense nearby creatures through vibration and air or water movement.
top.name: Motion Sense

entries: A creature that hits a verdurous ooze with a metal weapon or unarmed attack must attempt a DC 21 Reflex save. On a failure, the weapon or creature takes {@damage 2d4} acid damage (after dealing damage to the ooze as normal). Thrown weapons take this damage automatically with no save.
mid.name: Corrosive Surface

entries: 20 feet. The verdurous ooze constantly emits supernatural vapors that cause nearby plants to grow rapidly and writhe and grasp at anything and everything within the emanation. This area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for non–verdurous ooze creatures. When a creature starts its turn in this aura, it must succeed at a DC 21 Reflex save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the emanation.
mid.name: Enliven Foliage

entries: When a verdurous ooze that has 10 or more HP is hit by an attack that would deal piercing or slashing damage, it splits into two identical oozes, each with half the original's HP. One ooze is in the same space as the original, and the other is in an adjacent, unoccupied space. If no adjacent space is unoccupied, it automatically pushes creatures and objects out of the way to fill a space (the GM decides if an object or creature is too big or heavy to push).
mid.name: Split

entries: {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning plus {@damage 1d6} acid, DC 24
bot.name: Constrict

entries: The verdurous ooze adjusts its aura of supernatural vapors to affect living creatures within a 20-foot emanation, forcing them to attempt a DC 24 Will save.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Sleep Gas for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature falls {@condition unconscious}. If it's still {@condition unconscious} after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature falls {@condition unconscious}. If it's still {@condition unconscious} after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.

bot.name: Sleep Gas

entries: A verdurous ooze's acid damages only metal and flesh—not bone, stone, or other materials.
bot.name: Verdurous Ooze Acid

entries: A creature that can hear gains a +2 circumstance bonus to its {@skill Perception} DC against a vexgit's attempts to {@action Sneak}.
top.name: Clacking Exoskeleton

entries: When exposed to a {@trait cold} effect, the viper vine is overwhelmed by lethargy, becoming {@condition slowed 1} for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
mid.name: Cold Vulnerability

entries: The viper vine releases a 60-foot emanation of {@condition invisible} pollen that stays in the air for 5 rounds unless dispersed by a moderate or stronger wind. Each creature that enters or starts its turn in the area must attempt a DC 33 Will save or be captivated. The viper vine can't use Captivating Pollen for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Captivating Pollen for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The creature is {@condition sickened 1}.
entries.Failure: The creature is {@condition fascinated}, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the viper vine as expediently as possible while avoiding obvious dangers. If a captivated creature is adjacent to the viper vine, it stays still and doesn't act. It ceases to be {@condition fascinated} if it's no longer in the pollen aura at the end of its turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, plus the creature is {@condition stupefied 2} for 24 hours.

bot.name: Captivating Pollen

entries: {@damage 3d8+8} bludgeoning, DC 33
bot.name: Constrict

entries: Salt water acts as an extremely strong acid on the larval akata inside the void zombie. Full immersion in salt water deals {@damage 4d6} acid damage per round. On any round in which the void zombie takes damage due to its salt water weakness, the larval akata retreats to the depths of the void zombie's body, causing the void zombie to become {@condition slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.
mid.name: Salt Water Vulnerability

bot.requirements: The void zombie's previous action was a successful feeding tendril {@action Strike} against the target creature
entries: The void zombie uses its feeding tendril to drain blood from the creature struck. The void zombie regains 4 Hit Points, and the creature is {@condition drained 1} until it receives healing of any kind or amount.
bot.name: Feed on Blood

entries: 30 feet. When a non-demon ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save. If it fails, it becomes {@condition drained 1}.
mid.name: Death-Stealing Gaze

entries: A vrolikai can manifest a dagger-shaped blade of what looks like crystallized black flame in each of their four hands. These weapons function as +2 greater striking daggers, although they fade away into nothingness 1 minute after a vrolikai no longer carries them.
bot.name: Black Flame Knives

entries: The vrolikai focuses their death-stealing gaze upon a single target they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against death-stealing gaze.

entries.Success: The creature is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The creature is affected by deathstealing gaze and becomes {@condition drained 1}. If the creature was already {@condition drained 1} by the death-stealing gaze before attempting the save, a failed save increases the value of the {@condition drained} condition by 1, to a maximum of {@condition drained 4}. The vrolikai gains 10 temporary Hit Points, and the {@condition drained} creature is temporarily immune until the start of the vrolikai's next turn.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature increases the amount of drain by 2.

bot.name: Consume Death

entries: The vrolikai attacks a single target with all of its black flame knives. The demon makes a black flame knife {@action Strike}. On a successful attack, the vrolikai deals the damage from a black flame knife {@action Strike} to the target, plus an additional {@damage 2d6} negative damage for every black flame knife they wield beyond the first (typically {@damage 6d6} extra damage). Even on a failed attack, the vrolikai deals the damage from one black flame knife to the target, though they still miss completely on a critical failure. On a critical hit, the victim becomes {@condition drained 2} as the focused attack drains pure life essence as well as damage. This counts toward the vrolikai's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of black flame knives the demon wields.
bot.name: Focused Flames

entries: The sting of a vrolikai is mind-warping. A creature struck must attempt a DC 44 Will save.

entries.Success: The creature becomes {@condition stupefied 1} for 1 minute.
entries.Failure: The creature becomes {@condition stupefied 1}. Further failed saves against mindwarping increase the condition value by 1, to a maximum of {@condition stupefied 4}.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature also becomes {@condition confused} for 1 minute.

bot.name: Mindwarping

If a creature is targeted with this ability in consecutive rounds, the save DC decreases by 2 each round after the first.

entries.Critical Success: The target immediately awakens and is then temporarily immune to {@action Steal} Breath for 24 hours.
entries.Success: The target is unaffected.
entries.Failure: The target takes {@dice 1d10} damage.
entries.Critical Failure: The target is reduced to 0 HP and becomes {@condition dying 1}.

While in this form, a water orm's swim Speed increases to 600 feet, it automatically succeeds at {@skill Athletics} checks to swim, and it gains a +4 circumstance bonus to {@skill Stealth} checks in water. A water orm can remain in this form for 8 hours, but it can't enter salt water when using this ability. A water orm can return to its normal form using a single action which has the {@trait concentrate} trait.

The yai can also turn into a puddle of water, with the effects of gaseous form except they retain their land Speed, double their swim Speed, and can't fly.

entries.Failure: The target takes {@damage 5d6} electricity damage but is not {@condition grabbed}.

entries: The witchfire adds nightmare, phantasmal killer, phantasmal calamity, and summon entity to their coven's spells. A coven can contain one or more witchfires, but it must also include at least one living creature capable of forming a coven; three witchfires cannot form a coven.

mid.trigger: A creature makes a melee

entries.Critical Success: The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to witchflame for 1 hour.
entries.Success: The creature appears to catch fire with sickly green flames. These flames deal no damage on their own, but as long as the flames burn, the creature can't be {@condition concealed} ({@condition invisible} creatures are {@condition concealed} rather than being {@condition undetected}) and gains weakness 5 to fire for 1 round.
entries.Failure: As success, but the effect is permanent until removed.

entries: The witchwyrd "catches" the missile, absorbing it and causing that hand to glow while it holds this energy. A hand that's holding energy can't be used for any other purpose except to use Force Bolt. The energy lasts for 6 rounds or until it is released.
mid.name: Absorb Force

entries: The witchwyrd fires one magic missile per action spent (dealing {@damage 1d4+1} force damage each). They can't spend more actions on this ability than they have free hands. If they use a hand that has Absorbed Force, that hand hurls two missiles instead of one, expending the held energy.

entries: The wolverine enters a state of pure rage that lasts either for 1 minute, until there are no enemies it can perceive, or until it falls {@condition unconscious}, whichever comes first. While raging, the wolverine has AC 17, its jaws {@action Strike} deals {@dice 1d8+7} damage, and its claw {@action Strike} deals {@dice 1d6+7} damage. While raging, the wolverine can't use actions that have the {@trait concentrate} trait, except for {@action Seek}.
After it's stopped raging, a wolverine can't use Wolverine {@action Rage} again for 1 minute.
bot.name: Wolverine Rage

entries: The wood giant shoots an arrow at a target so that it glances off the first target to strike another target behind the first one. The wood giant chooses two targets in a direct line, one of which must be giving lesser cover to the other, then makes a single ranged {@action Strike} with its longbow against both targets. This attack ignores the lesser cover the first target provides to the second. The wood giant rolls damage only once, and applies it to each creature it hits.

entries: Shot counts as two attacks for the wood giant's multiple attack penalty.

entries: harmed by fire ({@dice 4d8}, {@dice 2d6} from areas or {@condition persistent damage}); healed by plant (area {@dice 2d6} HP); {@condition slowed} by earth.

entries: A jagged, sizable splinter of wood lances out at the golem's attacker. The golem makes a splinter {@action Strike} against an adjacent creature without triggering reactions.

entries: The wood golem makes up to four splinter {@action Strike||Strikes}, each against a different target. These attacks count toward the wood golem's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the wood golem makes all of its attacks.

entries: When the worm that walks is reduced to 0 HP, it discorporates and the component worms that make up its body disperse in every direction. If even a single worm escapes, the worm that walks will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes {@dice 1d10} days.

While the exact circumstances and surroundings determine how long the worm that walks's foes have to dispatch the fleeing worms before they escape, usually its foes have only a single round. Typically, this requires the application of an area effect or splash weapon within 1 round to the space where the worm that walks collapsed. After any amount of area or splash damage is dealt to that space, the character dealing the damage must attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. Each subsequent area or splash damage effect performed on the area reduces the DC of this flat check by 2, to a minimum of DC {@flatDC 5}. If any of these flat checks succeed, none of the worms escape, and the worm that walks is destroyed permanently. At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or otherwise detaining the vermin may extend the time allowed to finish off the worm that walks.
mid.name: Discorporate

entries: {@damage 5d8} piercing, DC 32
bot.name: Squirming Embrace

entries: The worm that walks collapses into a shapeless swarm of worms. It drops all held, worn, and carried items. While discorporated, the worm that walks can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but it can move through areas small enough for its individual worms to fit without having to {@action Squeeze}. It can use the same action to coalesce back into its normal form.
bot.name: Swarm Shape

entries: The dragon breathes a blast of darkness that deals {@damage 12d6} negative energy damage in a 30-foot cone (DC 30 basic Reflex save). They can't use Breath Weapon again for {@dice 1d4} rounds. Undead creatures take {@damage 14d6} force damage instead of the negative damage.
bot.name: Breath Weapon

entries: The dragon makes two claw {@action Strike||Strikes} and one wing {@action Strike} in any order.
bot.name: Draconic Frenzy

entries: The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a {@action Strike}.
bot.name: Draconic Momentum

entries: An umbral dragon's {@action Strike||Strikes} affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a {@item ghost touch} property rune, and an umbral dragon's jaws deal an additional {@damage 4d6} force damage to undead.
bot.name: Ghost Bane

attacks.name: mandibles
attacks.damage: {@damage 1d10+3} piercing plus {@damage 1d6} evil and Cocytan filth

entries: The zebub records everything they see, and though they don't remember all observations, they can pass them along to another creature. The zebub replays 10 minutes of witnessed events to a touched willing creature, which receives the memories in a flash of information. By remaining in contact, the zebub can spend additional 3-action activities to replay more information. After relaying their visions to another, the zebub can't ever recall those events again.
bot.name: Infernal Eye

entries: The zebub's {@action Strike||Strikes} deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage to {@condition flat-footed} creatures.
bot.name: Sneak Attack

attacks.name: chain
attacks.damage: {@damage 2d10+6} slashing plus {@damage 2d6} electricity and {@damage 1d6} lawful plus Knockdown

entries: A zelekhut can speak with and understand any creature with a language.
top.name: Truespeech

entries: The zelekhut makes two chain {@action Strike||Strikes}, each targeting a different creature. Each {@action Strike} counts toward the zelekhut's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it has made both attacks. If the zelekhut subsequently uses the Knockdown action, it affects all creatures it hit with Double Attack.
bot.name: Double Attack

entries: The zomok blasts forth a 60-foot cone of earth and gravel, dealing {@damage 17d6} bludgeoning damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save); {@condition prone} creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to this saving throw. Creatures touching the ground that fail their saves take a 10-foot circumstance penalty to their Speeds and are {@condition restrained} ({@action Escape} DC 34) on a critical failure. The zomok can't use Entombing Breath again for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

The bodies of creatures slain by Entombing Breath instantly decompose and are destroyed—they can be restored to life only by a 7th-level or higher spell or ritual that restores life. The creature's equipment is unharmed but buried under 5 feet of earth.
bot.name: Entombing Breath

entries: The zomok teleports itself with the effects of a 5th-level {@spell dimension door} spell, but the zomok must begin and end the {@trait teleportation} effect in forest terrain. The zomok regains {@dice 10d10} Hit Points during this teleportation. Creatures swallowed by the zomok are left behind. The zomok can't use Forest {@action Step} again for {@dice 1d6+1} rounds.
bot.name: Forest Step

entries: Huge, {@damage 3d12+9} bludgeoning, Rupture 35.
bot.name: Swallow Whole

entries: Huge or smaller, tail, DC 32
bot.name: Trample
